title: Virtual Assistent DTC Brand
description:
Virtual Assistant for Growing DTC Brand (Long-Term Position)



Position: Virtual Assistant

Type: Part-Time (20 hours per week to start)

Location: Remote

Time zone: Must have at least 2–3 hours overlap with CET

Salary: Please include your hourly rate in your application



We are a growing DTC e-commerce brand looking for a smart, organized, and proactive Virtual Assistant to support daily operations.



This is a long-term role. We are not looking for someone who just follows instructions. We want someone who thinks, pays attention to detail, and takes ownership of their work.



Your responsibilities will include competitor research. You will track brands, analyze their websites, study their offers, check Meta Ad Library, monitor active ads, and document traffic data using tools like Similarweb. You will organize everything clearly in Notion.



You will also do creative research. This includes finding ads on TikTok and Meta, identifying patterns in high-performing creatives, writing short breakdowns of hooks and angles, and keeping a structured library of winning ads.



You will support product research by analyzing customer reviews, extracting pain points, and summarizing recurring problems customers mention.



You may assist with light customer support organization such as organizing FAQs, identifying repeated questions, and helping structure response templates.



You will help maintain our Notion workspace and keep databases structured and clean.



Using ChatGPT efficiently is a must. You should understand how to write strong prompts and use AI to improve research, organization, and content output. Experience with AI image generators is also required. You should be comfortable generating and refining visuals when needed. Experience with social media management is required, including understanding content scheduling, basic engagement management, and platform organization.



We are looking for someone who has experience in e-commerce or DTC brands, writes clear English, works independently, is highly organized, and is comfortable using research tools. Experience with Meta Ad Library, TikTok research, or Similarweb is a strong plus.



This is not a beginner role. You must be comfortable thinking critically and working without constant supervision.



To apply, send a short introduction about yourself, your experience with e-commerce or DTC brands, examples of research work you have done, the tools you are comfortable with, your availability, and your hourly rate.



You must also include a short video introduction (1–2 minutes). Start the video by clearly saying: Hello Ricardo. This helps us confirm the video is recorded specifically for this application.



Start your written application with the word “Research” so we know you read everything carefully.



We are looking to hire soon and build a long-term working relationship.

title: Phone Setter
description:
DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU SUBMIT THE REQUIRED LOOM ROLEPLAY AND FOLLOW ALL INSTRUCTIONS BELOW. APPLICATIONS WITHOUT A LOOM WILL BE IGNORED. ????



I’m hiring a phone dialer / appointment setter to make outbound calls to people who have already joined my online community.



This is NOT cold sales.

You’ll be calling warm leads to:



• Qualify them

• Extract their real problem

• Shift their thinking

• Book qualified calls on my calendar



If you rely on scripts, sound timid on the phone, or struggle with real conversations — do not apply.



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:



• Outbound calls to warm leads (US & Canada)

• Following a clear call framework (training provided)

• Asking direct questions to uncover objections

• Challenging weak logic respectfully

• Booking same-day appointments

• Taking notes after each call



WHAT I’M LOOKING FOR:



• Confident English speaker (neutral/US/UK accent preferred)

• Comfortable leading conversations

• Speaks with conviction (not robotic or scripted)

• Thinks logically under pressure

• Not afraid of silence or pushback

• Reliable internet + quiet environment



MANDATORY STEP 2 (REQUIRED TO BE CONSIDERED)

???? Part 1 – Listen to These Recordings:



Recording 1:





Listen from 7:32



Recording 2:





Listen from 3:39 and 21:52



Pay attention to tone, pace, conviction, problem extraction, belief shifting, and how the call leads to a booking.



???? Part 2 – Loom Roleplay (5–8 mins max)



Record a Loom acting out this scenario:



• Prospect joined community

• Looking into starting an agency for 2 months

• Works a 9–5

• Says it’s a priority

• Hasn’t started

• 0 clients, $0 made

• Stuck in learning mode



In your Loom you must:



• Open with authority (no scripts)

• Qualify properly

• Extract the real problem

• Shift their belief logically

• Invite to next step naturally



?? Do NOT explain what you would say.

?? Do NOT read notes.

Act it out like a real call.



AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFICATION:



• No Loom submitted

• Script reading

• Over-explaining instead of questioning

• Sounding unsure or apologetic

• Avoiding challenge



Pay: Hourly or per booking (discussed after screening). Long-term role available.



If you can think clearly, lead conversations, and handle pressure — submit your Loom link.



Only serious applicants will be considered.

title: E-commerce Product & Operations Lead (Remote – Long Term)
description:
This Is NOT a VA Role



We are not looking for a general virtual assistant. We are looking for a thinking partner who can take ownership of our e-commerce product and operations engine. If you enjoy researching products, analyzing competitors, improving systems, sourcing suppliers, and building structure inside a growing brand, this may be a fit.



About Us



Party & Presents is a growing personalized party supply and custom gifts brand. We design thoughtful products that create meaningful experiences. We are looking to add someone to the team who can help us:



- Research and identify promising new products

- Build structured product lines

- Improve packaging and customer experience

- Source and evaluate suppliers



You’ll Be Responsible For:



- Product Research & Selection

Research trends across Etsy, Amazon, Pinterest, TikTok

Analyze demand, competition, and pricing

Propose new product ideas with data and reasoning

Help refine and build a cohesive product line



- Supplier Research & Sourcing

Identify reliable suppliers (local & international)

Compare costs, MOQs, and turnaround times

Maintain an organized supplier database



- Packaging & Experience Optimization

Suggest packaging improvements

Balance cost vs. perceived value

Help create memorable unboxing experiences

Standardize packaging workflows



- Cross-Team Coordination

Work with designers and the production team

Turn ideas into clear product briefs

Prepare structured launch plans



The Ideal Candidate will be/have:

- 2+ years of experience in e-commerce

- Strong research and analytical skills

- Ability to make independent decisions

- Highly organized

- Strong written & spoken English

- Experience using spreadsheets and project management tools (nice-to-have)



Preferred:

- Experience launching or managing products

- Experience in Etsy, Shopify, or Amazon

- Basic understanding of margins and cost structure

- Experience sourcing from Alibaba or other suppliers

- Personality Fit



This role is for someone who wants to grow into a leadership position long-term.



IMPORTANT: How to Apply



1. Please provide a copy of your resume and portfolio (if you have any)



2. To filter serious applicants, please follow these steps:



- In your subject line, write:

“E-commerce Lead – [Your Favorite Product Category from answer below].”



- Then, answer these 3 questions:

A. Choose one product you believe we should add to a personalized party supply store and explain WHY (include demand reasoning).

B. Describe one system or process you improved in a past job.

C. If given 10 competitor stores, how would you d
 what products are worth copying or improving?



Applications without these answers will not be reviewed.



Thanks, and we look forward to meeting the latest member of our growing team :)

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Role: Senior Accountant

Salary: $1500 (negotiable)

Remote (Philippines-based) | Full-time (40 hours/week) | U.S. PST hours or significant overlap



ABOUT THE ROLE

A high growth U.S.-based F&B franchise is seeking a Senior Accountant to work with the CFO & VP of Finance take ownership of recurring finance operations, reporting, and data workflows across its 200+ franchise business. This role is designed to remove manual, repeatable finance work from senior leaders and introduce more consistency, structure, and scalability into reporting and finance processes.



What You’ll Do:

- Manage end-to-end financial reporting and operations for a U.S.-based F&B franchise, including preparing and consolidating Excel reports from multiple systems, validating data, and overseeing 200+ franchisee P&Ls. 

- Handle finance operations, royalty fee workflows, and administrative tasks with minimal supervision. 

- Drive process improvements, implement and optimize tools like QuickBooks, Avalara, and Concur, and document workflows to streamline recurring finance tasks.



Requirements:

- 2+ years of experience with accounting, finance, banking, or bookkeeping (or BPO experience supporting those industries) 

- 2+ years experience in financial reporting, financial operations, and FP&A roles (U.S. companies preferred) 

- Expert Excel proficiency (pivot tables, lookups, formulas, data cleaning/merging, data validation)

- Solid understanding of financial statements, especially P&Ls

- Strong proficiency in English (at least C1 level), with excellent written communication skills

- Self-starter with creating net-new processes and automations 

- Intense attention to detail

- Exceptionally organized, proactive, and capable of driving tasks to completion with minimal supervision 

- Bachelor Degree or higher (summa, magna or cum laude and/or Academic Scholar from a reputable college preferred)



Preferred: 

- Previous experience working with U.S. restaurant / F&B operators 

- Familiarity with sales tax software (ideally Avalara) 

- Familiarity with Quickbooks

- Curiosity about AI (e.g. ChatGPT, Claude) and desire to experiment with AI in day-to-day work

- Licensed CPA 



To apply, send your resume and a short introduction

dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

title: Lead Generation Specialist (Remote) — CostGenie & IntelliFM
description:
Lead Generation & Early Customer Acquisition Specialist (Remote)



CostGenie & IntelliFM - 
 & 



Company Overview



CostGenie and IntelliFM are early-stage SaaS platforms built to solve real operational and commercial problems across procurement, finance, operations, and facilities management.



The platforms are built, but they are pre-scale. This is the stage where customer feedback, real conversations, and qualified onboarding matter more than vanity metrics. We are now looking to bring in a strong lead generation professional to help us onboard our first wave of serious customers, validate pricing, and shape how these products go to market.



This is not a polished corporate sales role — it’s a build phase role.



Role Summary



We are hiring a hands-on Lead Generation & Early Customer Acquisition Specialist to help us:



Identify and onboard solid, qualified customers



Drive early traction and revenue conversations



Support the validation of pricing models, ICPs, and messaging



Feed real-world insight back into the product, landing pages, and sales process



You will be working directly with the founder and sales leadership during the most important phase of the business.



Key Responsibilities



Identify and source high-quality B2B prospects aligned to our target customers



Engage decision-makers across Finance, Procurement, Operations, and Facilities Management



Run outbound outreach via LinkedIn and
 (tools such as Apollo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.)



Qualify prospects properly — this role is about quality over volume



Book and support onboarding calls with genuinely interested prospects



Help gather feedback on:



Pricing expectations



Feature priorities



Buying objections



Support the refinement of:



Pricing structure



Sales messaging



Landing page content and positioning



Keep CRM and lead data clean and up to date



Report weekly on progress, learnings, and opportunities



What We’re Looking For



2+ years experience in B2B lead generation / SDR / outbound sales



Comfortable working with early-stage products that are still being refined



Strong communicator with confident written and spoken English



Able to qualify leads properly (budget, authority, need, timing)



Commercially minded — understands that early customers shape the product



Organised, proactive, and comfortable working without rigid scripts



This Role Is Ideal If You:



Enjoy helping build something from the ground up



Are comfortable selling before everything is “perfect”



Like working closely with founders and influencing strategy



Care more about closing real customers than hitting vanity KPIs



Initial Targets (Flexible, Not Rigid)



Consistent flow of qualified, sales-ready prospects



Early customer onboarding and feedback loops



Clear insight into pricing sensitivity and buyer behaviour



(These will evolve as the business matures.)



What We Offer



Competitive pay (based on experience)



Fully remote, flexible working



Long-term opportunity as the platforms scale



Potential to grow into Head of Lead Gen / Sales Ops as traction builds



Direct access to founders and decision-making



Important Note



These platforms are not fully launched or polished yet. We are intentionally hiring now to bring in someone who can help shape the go-to-market motion while driving early customers.



If you need everything pre-packaged, this role is not for you.

If you enjoy building, validating, and scaling — you’ll thrive here.

mbers.

title: HR Adminstrator
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The HR Administrator is responsible for building, documenting, organizing, and facilitating the execution of People Advisory deliverables across multiple clients. This role supports the Director of People in the design and delivery of onboarding plans, job descriptions, Employee Maturity Models (EMM), organizational charts, compensation frameworks, and structured HR tools.



This individual ensures that client orders (tickets) are executed with precision, speed, and consistency within established KPIs. They operate as the systems backbone of the People Advisory function, transforming strategy into structured, documented, client-ready deliverables.



This is a highly independent role requiring strong organizational discipline, business acumen, and process thinking. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, manages ambiguity well, and can translate complex people strategy into structured, usable tools.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.







SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Client deliverables are built, formatted, and prepared on time within KPI expectations

- Onboarding plans, JDs, org charts, and EMMs are structured, standardized, and scalable

- People Advisory tickets move efficiently from intake ? build ? review ? client delivery

- Process templates are continually refined to reduce build time and increase quality

- The Director of People operates at a higher strategic level due to execution leverage

- No deliverables stall due to administrative breakdowns or workflow confusion

- Quality control standards are maintained across all outgoing materials



OBJECTIVES

- Facilitate the build and preparation of all People Advisory client deliverables within designated turnaround KPIs.

- Draft structured onboarding plans aligned to role, industry, and client maturity.

- Build and format job descriptions using standardized People Advisory templates.

- Develop Employee Maturity Models (EMM) customized to client organizational stages.

- Create and maintain organizational charts reflecting client growth and reporting structures.

- Manage intake workflow of People Advisory tickets from multiple departments.

- Ensure deliverables are properly formatted, quality checked, and client-ready prior to Director review.

- Maintain documentation systems for templates, revisions, and client version control.

- Track project timelines and follow up on internal dependencies to avoid delays.

- Identify inefficiencies in current People Advisory build processes and recommend improvements.

- Maintain organized storage of all client documentation across platforms (Drive, Asana, LMS, etc.).

- Reduce Director of People, Core Client Operations review and edit time by increasing first-draft accuracy and completeness.



COMPETENCIES

- Strong business acumen and understanding of organizational structure

- Process design and workflow thinking

- Advanced written communication and formatting skills

- High attention to detail and quality control discipline

- Proficiency in project management software (Asana or similar)

- Proficiency in Google Workspace (Docs, Slides, Sheets)

- Ability to translate strategic direction into structured documentation

- Time management in a fast-paced, multi-client environment

- Analytical thinking and structured problem-solving

- Comfort working independently with minimal supervision

- Template development and document standardization capability

- Professional judgment when handling sensitive HR-related materials



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

- Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, Organizational Development, or related field preferred

- 2–5 years experience in HR Operations, People Operations, Business Operations, or Process Administration

- Experience building job descriptions, onboarding programs, or organizational documentation preferred

- Experience supporting consulting, advisory, or multi-client environments is a strong plus

- Experience working within KPI-driven environments preferred



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY



As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Business Analyst
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Business Analyst is solely responsible for owning, building, and delivering the Expansion Analysis (EA) and Target Market Analysis (TMA) components of the client-facing deliverable. This role transforms client data into actionable insights and collaborates closely with ETL, Client-Facing PR Teams, and Visual teams to ensure data quality, analytic integrity, and strategic alignment. The Business Analyst ensures that EA and TMA outputs are accurate, enriched, and directly tied to cohesive, data-driven recommendations.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Consistently deliver precise, insightful analyses that transform raw data into actionable insights, directly supporting client growth and decision-making.

- Ensure that each section of the client deliverable is cohesive and seamlessly aligned with other sections, creating a consistent and logically structured analysis that effectively communicates clear insights and actionable recommendations.

- Complete all analysis projects on time, maintaining a balance between speed and quality while meeting client expectations.

- Present findings in a clear, compelling manner, ensuring client teams and clients easily understand insights and receive actionable recommendations.

- Work seamlessly with cross-functional teams (ETL, Platform Review, and Visualization) to ensure accurate, aligned, and timely data analysis deliverables, proactively resolving data issues.



OBJECTIVES

- Deliver 5 high-quality EA and TMA analyses monthly, aligning with team deliverable targets.

- Ensure analyses achieve 100?curacy and strategic alignment with internal and client expectations.

- Produce insights that inform client strategies, such as increased market penetration and customer retention.

- Conduct market selection analyses to optimize Total Serviceable Market Opportunity (TSMO).

- Accurately segment and analyze client customer bases to refine retargeting strategies.

- Maintain robust stakeholder engagement, regularly interfacing with cross-functional teams.

- Provide data clarity by ensuring datasets are structured and enriched for insight-readiness.

- Leverage tools like Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, and SQL for data analysis and visualization as well as various data aggregation tools and subscriptions.

- Support data pipeline validation and ensure data integrity across all reporting layers.

- Document and present findings in a clear, actionable format to inform strategic decisions.



COMPETENCIES

 - Expertise in data visualization tools like Power BI.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Fabric (Spark Notebooks, Lakehouse, Delta Tables).

- Strong ETL knowledge and ability to collaborate on data readiness.

- Advanced Excel, SQL, and familiarity with Azure Maps.

- Effective communication and stakeholder management.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

- Ability to synthesize data into actionable insights.

- Adaptability and collaboration in cross-functional teams.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.

- 3+ years of experience in a similar role with a focus on market and customer analysis.

- Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality insights under strict deadlines.

- Experience working with datasets for customer segmentation and market opportunity analysis.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer

- Must be able to operate standard office equipment and work for extended periods at a computer.



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY



As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Recruiter
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Recruiter will be responsible for identifying hiring needs and filling job openings. The responsibilities of a recruiter include identifying future hiring needs, designing job descriptions, sourcing candidates through databases and social media, conducting interviews, filing paperwork, and keeping abreast of employment law and legislation. You should also monitor new and existing employees and act as their advocate.



This position is 100% remote.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.





SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Open roles are filled efficiently with high-quality, aligned candidates

- Hiring managers feel supported and informed throughout the recruitment process

- Candidates have a smooth, professional, and inspiring experience

- Talent pipelines are proactively built and maintained

- Recruitment data and metrics are tracked and used to improve performance

- The company’s brand is positively represented in every hiring interaction

- Core values are consistently reflected in all recruitment efforts

- Compliance with employment laws and best practices is maintained

- You take ownership, hit your goals, and contribute to company growth





OBJECTIVES

- Identifying future hiring needs and developing job descriptions and specifications.

- Collaborating with department managers to compile a consistent list of requirements.

- Attracting suitable candidates through databases, online employment forums, social media, etc.

- Conducting interviews and sorting through applicants to fill open positions.

- Assessing applicants' knowledge, skills, and experience to best suit open positions.

- Completing paperwork for new hires.

- Promoting the company's reputation and attractiveness as a good employment opportunity.

- Managing internship programs.

- Keeping up-to-date on current employment legislation and regulations and enforcing them within the company.

- Providing recruitment reports to team managers.





COMPETENCIES

- The ability to conduct different types of interviews.

- Experience with recruitment processes and databases.

- The ability to design and implement recruiting strategies.

- Excellent communication skills.

- Good interpersonal skills.

- Good decision-making skills.

- A working knowledge of employment law and legislation.

- At least 3 years’ experience in a human resources/recruitment environment





PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

- Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer





COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.





If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Junior Video Editor (Paid Ad Creatives)
description:
Hey there! We're Hest Enterprises — an eCommerce brand that is scaling globally. 



We're looking for a Junior Video Editor to join our fast growing team. 



Your mission? Collaborate with our Creative Strategist & Copywriter to produce ad creatives that actually convert and help scale our brands to multiple 7 figures+.



Important! If you have zero interest in learning why ads work (not just making them look pretty), this role isn't for you. But if you're hungry to learn marketing while sharpening your editing skills...



Who We're Looking For



One golden rule at our company: you must have the DESIRE to learn & grow. If you're not passionate about getting better every week, this isn't the place for you.



The purpose of this role isn't just editing videos — it's learning how to edit for performance. You'll learn how hooks grab attention, how emotional pacing drives watch time, and how the right angle maximizes ROAS. We'll train you on the marketing side — you bring the hunger.



You're a great fit if you:



- Love editing videos and want to get seriously good at it

- Are curious about what makes ads actually convert

- Take feedback well and move fast on revisions

- Are organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

- Want to grow into a Creative Strategist role over time (not necessary)



What You'll Do Day-to-Day



- Edit short-form video ads (UGC, product clips, b-roll)

- Assemble ads using provided scripts, briefs, and reference examples

- Add text overlays, captions, cuts, and pacing optimized for ads

- Create variations from the same core footage for testing

- Help document ad structure in simple briefs (hook, message, CTA)

- Make revisions based on internal feedback

- Keep files and exports organized for the team

- Attend weekly learning check-ins



Required:



- Experience with Video Editing ads (CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar)

- Clear written English

- Ability to follow instructions and hit deadlines

- Open & Curious to Feedback and Revisions

- Organised and reliable



Why Join Us?



- Bonuses & Profit Share — You'll earn bonuses tied to the performance of ads you help create. When your work converts, you get rewarded.

- Real Training — Not just video editing. We'll train you on ad structures, creative strategy, and how to edit for results. You'll learn marketing fundamentals most junior editors never get exposed to.

- Growth Path — There's a clear path from Junior Editor ? Creative Strategist based on performance. We promote from within.



How Does This Work?



We hold our team to high standards and reward great work — expect your rates to grow as you do. Here's our simple hiring process:



- Send a short intro video about yourself and your experience,

- A portfolio or samples of video edits (ads preferred) 

- Culture and Values Interview

- Complete a quick editing assessment tailored for the role

- Final interview with our Founder to discuss fit and finalize an offer



If this resonates with you, let's chat! Choose the number of the core value you feel aligns with you most and include it in your application:



1 - RESULTS OBSESSED 

2 - ATTENTION TO DETAIL 

3 - ACCELERATED EXCELLENCE 

4 - RELENTLESS OWNERSHIP 

5 - PREPARED TO WIN 

6 - COLLABORATIVE INNOVATION 

7 - NEVER NOT GROWING



Apply now and let's grow together!

title: Junior Video Editor (Paid Ads)
description:
About the Role:

We’re an eCommerce brand that is expanding globally.



This role is primarily a video editing role focused on producing short-form ad creatives for platforms like
. You’ll work from clear direction and examples, while also helping prepare simple ad briefs so editors and media buyers stay aligned.



This is an execution-first role with light creative input. You don’t need to be a strategist, but you should understand why ads are structured the way they are.





What You’ll Do

- Edit short-form video ads (UGC, product clips, simple statics)

- Assemble ads using provided scripts, briefs, and references

- Add basic text overlays, captions, cuts, and pacing for ads

- Create simple variations from the same core footage

- Help document ad structure in basic ad briefs (hook, message, CTA)

- Make revisions based on internal feedback

- Organize files and exports clearly for the team

- Attend weekly internal check-ins





What We’re Looking For



Required

- Basic video editing skills (CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar)

- Comfortable editing short-form videos (15–60 seconds)

- Clear written English

- Able to follow instructions and meet deadlines

- Open to feedback and revisions

- Organized and reliable



Nice to Have (Not Required)

- Experience editing ads or UGC-style content

- Familiarity with
 or 
 ads

- Basic understanding of hooks, captions, and CTAs

- Experience working with Google Drive or Notion





Training & Growth



You’ll be trained on:

- Our ad structures and creative standards

- How to edit for performance (not aesthetics)

- How ad briefs are used to guide creative



There is room to grow into a Creative Producer or Creative Strategist role over time, based on performance.





This Role Is For You If:

- You enjoy editing videos and improving pacing

- You want to learn how ads actually work

- You’re detail-oriented and coachable

- You like structured work with clear direction



This Role Is Not For You If

- You want full creative freedom immediately

- You dislike revisions or fast turnarounds

- You’re looking for a senior editing or strategy role





How to Apply



Please send:

1. A short intro video about yourself 

2. A portfolio or samples of video edits (ads preferred, but not required)

3. The editing tools you use

title: Ecom Video Editor
description:
In search for a new editor for our social media marketing agency.



We specialise in TikTok Shop and Meta ads: so short form ecom videos.



You will have your own Creative Strategist assigning you briefs daily, and your own clients which you will be responsible for the workload.



Experience in editing organic social media videos, ecommerce ads (TikTok, Meta) is absolutely nessessary. If you do not have experience, please do not apply.



Experience with Eleven Labs or similar AI Voiceover tools is also required. Experience with AI generative tools is also valued. Tools like Seedance, HeyGen, Sora etc.



Attention to detail is highly valued. You will be responsble for checking your own work for typos, jump frames, captions in safe zone etc. If you fail to fix small errors like these and prove to be a liability, you will not last long.



Speed and output is highly valued. 



If you have good attention to detail, can follow and work through briefs quickly, and have a creative mind, there is vast opportunity for growth in the agency, along with pay rises.



Your work will start with ecom ads for TikTok and Meta. But it may also include organic TikToks. The edits you make are expected to go viral, so you should understand how TikTok works, how to give the algorithm what it wants, how to make stong hooks and keep the viewer enagaged. 



If you have made videos that have gone viral before, or make TikTok Shop videos that have converted - we will be very impressed. However, if you only have experience in editing ecom ads, you stand just as much chance.



Please send example work and edits with details about brands/agencies you have worked for. Details about hwo your creatives performed as ads would also be great.



Can start work immediately!



Thank you, I look forward to hearing back :)



Troy

description:
Role: Senior Accountant

Remote (Philippines-based) | Full-time (40 hours/week) | U.S. PST hours or significant overlap



ABOUT THE ROLE

A high growth U.S.-based F&B franchise is seeking a Senior Accountant to work with the CFO & VP of Finance take ownership of recurring finance operations, reporting, and data workflows across its 200+ franchise business. This role is designed to remove manual, repeatable finance work from senior leaders and introduce more consistency, structure, and scalability into reporting and finance processes.

- Strong proficiency in English (at least C1 level), with excellent written communication skills

- Self-starter with creating net-new processes and automations

- Exceptionally organized, proactive, and capable of driving tasks to completion with minimal supervision

- Bachelor Degree or higher (summa, magna or cum laude and/or Academic Scholar from a reputable college preferred)



Preferred:

- Familiarity with Quickbooks

- Curiosity about AI (e.g. ChatGPT, Claude) and desire to experiment with AI in day-to-day work

description:
JOB TITLE:



Xero / QBO Bookkeeper (Catch-Up + Monthly + Month-End Close)

We are a growing Canadian accounting firm specializing in catch-up bookkeeping, clean-ups, and monthly bookkeeping for small businesses across Canada.

• Bank and credit card reconciliations

• Prepare monthly financial statements

• Complete month-end close procedures

• Ensure files are clean and ready for tax preparation

Strong Xero experience is required.

• Strong reconciliation skills

• Experience with QBO (preferred)

• Detail-oriented and organized

• Able to work independently

• Strong written English

• Willing to overlap with Canadian business hours when needed



COMPENSATION:

title: Product Manager (Technical) / Software Architect
description:
We are seeking a Technical Product Manager / Architect who bridges product design and engineering execution. This role combines system-level thinking, architectural oversight, and clear, actionable documentation—producing deliverables engineers can build from directly. The ideal candidate can translate business needs into architecture diagrams, wireframes, and well-scoped tickets with code-level precision, ensuring efficient handoff and reduced rework.



Requirements & Documentation

• Author architecture-aware product specifications including system diagrams, logic flows, and key technical dependencies.

• Prepare engineer-ready tickets, including pseudocode, scaffolding, or sample API structures.

• Conduct architecture and code reviews, identifying potential design or implementation issues early.

• Build wireframes, mockups, and interaction flows using Figma or equivalent tools to align engineering and UX/UI early in the cycle.

• Collaborate with engineering to ensure technical feasibility and architectural scalability before feature commitment.

Cross-Functional Execution

• Work closely with engineering leads to break down architecture into structured deliverables and sprint-ready tasks.

• Lead technical review sessions to validate assumptions and architecture decisions before coding begins.



Qualifications

• Strong understanding of software architecture principles, REST APIs, and modular system design.

• Hands-on experience writing or reviewing code in PHP, JavaScript, and SQL preferred.

• Proficiency in creating wireframes, prototypes, and UI flows that accurately reflect data and system constraints.

• Ability to evaluate trade-offs between architectural purity, delivery speed, and scalability.

• Prior experience functioning as a bridge between engineering and design, ensuring clarity and readiness for execution.

title: Engineering Manager (Delivery & Execution)
description:
We are seeking an Engineering manager who can own predictable delivery across engineering by enforcing sprint discipline, decision clarity, and execution standards. Reduce coordination cost, eliminate rework, and ensure that engineering output is reviewable, shippable, and on time.



Core Responsibilities



Sprint Ownership & Delivery Control

• Own sprint planning, execution, and closure

• Enforce sprint scope boundaries (no silent mid-sprint additions)

• Ensure all tickets entering a sprint meet Definition of Ready

• Track and act on: ticket aging, spillover, churn, blocked work

• Move tickets aggressively across states (TODO ? IN PROGRESS ? REVIEW ? DONE)

• Kill zombie tickets



Timebox Enforcement

• Treat timeboxes as coordination contracts, not estimates

• Require proactive communication before a timebox slips

• Block review if timebox standards are violated

• Escalate early, not after the fact



Execution Quality Gates

• Enforce: Definition of Ready (before sprint), Definition of Done (before release)

• Reject work that: contains implicit decisions, lacks acceptance criteria, introduces duplication without approval

• Ensure code review happens before QA

• Ensure QA does not compensate for missing engineering clarity



Decision Discipline (in partnership with TPM / Product)

• Require explicit tracking of: Open Decisions, Frozen Decisions

• Block execution on unresolved architectural decisions

• Ensure decisions are made by the right group, at the right time

• Prevent “decision by implementation”



5. Engineering Standards Enforcement

• Enforce agreed standards consistently: no duplication without approval, no implicit architecture decisions, no skipping ticket states

• Treat violations as delivery risk, not personal issues

• Track repeat violations and escalate



Required Skills & Traits



Must Have

• Strong judgment around delivery tradeoffs

• Comfort enforcing rules and saying “no”

• Ability to stop work and force alignment

• Low tolerance for ambiguity in execution

• Bias for early escalation over late heroics

• Calm under pressure, emotionally neutral

• Experience running sprints that actually ship

• Strong English language skills

• Familiarity with Jira-style workflows



Nice to Have

• Background as senior engineer

• Experience in SaaS / platform teams

• Worked alongside TPMs or Product Managers

title: Creative Performance Video Editor (Meta Ads Focus)
description:
CarMe is a fast-growing e-commerce company and one of the market leaders in the Netherlands and Belgium in the automotive accessories industry. Our mission is simple: make driving smarter and more enjoyable with innovative products.



We are looking for a Creative Performance Video Editor who specializes in turning raw content into high-performing paid ads. Your main focus will be repurposing UGC, product footage, and raw recordings into scroll-stopping video ads for Meta 
 & Instagram), and potentially other paid channels like TikTok and YouTube.



If you understand how to hook viewers in the first 3 seconds, structure ads for conversions, and continuously test new creative angles, this could be the perfect role for you.



What you’ll be doing

- Turning raw content (UGC, product demos, testimonials, lifestyle footage) into high-converting video ads

- Creating multiple variations of the same concept to test different hooks, angles, and formats

- Editing specifically for paid traffic (Meta as main focus)

- Optimizing videos based on performance data (CTR, CPA, thumb stop rate, etc.)

- Structuring ads according to proven frameworks (hook ? problem ? solution ? proof ? CTA)

- Adding subtitles, dynamic captions, motion graphics, and attention-grabbing elements

- Continuously improving creatives based on feedback from the media buying team

- Repurposing winning creatives into new versions to extend performance lifespan



What we’re looking for

- Proven experience editing video ads for Meta (this is essential)

- Strong understanding of direct-response marketing principles

- Experience with UGC-style ads and performance-driven creatives

- Ability to think in angles, hooks, and conversion psychology

- Skilled in tools like Premiere Pro, CapCut, After Effects, or similar

- Experience working with e-commerce brands

- Ability to work independently and deliver quickly

- Strong communication skills in English



Bonus points if you:

- Understand how to analyze ad performance metrics

- Have worked closely with media buyers before

- Can also script or suggest new creative concepts



What we offer

- Remote position with flexible working hours

- Competitive salary with performance-based growth opportunities

- Direct collaboration with the founder and media buying team

- Fast-paced environment where your creatives directly impact revenue

- The opportunity to scale internationally with a growing brand



Ready to join us?

If this sounds like the right fit for you, please send:

- Your portfolio (specifically video ads for paid social)

- Your CV

- A short motivation explaining why you’re a strong fit

- To make sure you’ve read the full job post, please include the word “engine” in your application.

title: Video Sound Design Expert Needed for Music & SFX
description:
Project Overview

We are a new YouTube channel producing cinematic, "short movie" style documentaries. Our first project involves a deep dive into how hackers stole $1.5 Billion from a CEO. We aren't just looking for a one-off freelancer; we are looking for a long-term partner to join our production pipeline.



The Mission

Your goal is to transform a standard edit into an immersive, high-tension experience. This isn’t just background music; it’s about creating a "tech-thriller" atmosphere. We want the audience to feel the tension of the hack, the scale of the theft, and the urgency of the investigation.



Key Responsibilities

Cinematic Soundscapes: Build an immersive audio environment using ambient textures, risers, and hits.



SFX Curation & Layering: Evaluate existing raw audio. If it works, enhance it. If it’s lacking, replace or layer it with high-quality SFX from your own licensed libraries (Epidemic Sound, Artlist, etc.).



Music Supervision: Select and place music that drives the narrative and manages pacing for a 20-minute runtime.



Audio Polishing: Ensure a professional final mix where dialogue is crisp and SFX are impactful but balanced.



Frequency & Workflow

Volume: We are scaling to 12 videos per month.



Length: Each video is approximately 20 minutes long.



Consistency: This is a long-term role for the right candidate. We need someone who can maintain high quality while meeting a rigorous production schedule.



Candidate Requirements

Speed & Quality: You must be able to deliver cinematic-level sound design on a tight turnaround.



Resourcefulness: You have access to professional sound libraries and know how to find the perfect "tech" or "thriller" sounds quickly.



Technical Proficiency: Expert-level skills in industry-standard software (Adobe Audition, DaVinci Resolve, Pro Tools, etc.).



How to Apply

If you have a passion for true crime and tech stories, we want to hear from you.

Provide a link to your portfolio (specifically work that shows high-engagement sound design).

Include a brief note about your workflow for handling high-volume projects.

Include the keyword "BREACH" in the first line of your application. Applications without this keyword will be automatically declined to ensure you have read the full project scope.

Include estimate of how long (in hours) it will take to add SFX & music to a 20 minute video.

title: YouTube Video Editor (Educational / Self-Improvement) - Long-Term Partner
description:
I run a self-improvement YouTube channel for young men. My content is helping them to feel more confident, deal with hardship, become more disciplined and get shit done. My main aim is to make personal growth practical. in order to do that, I am looking for an editor who can support me in this mission. I'm looking for a teammate who takes ownership of the visual quality, so that I can focus on the message itself.



You will be responsible for the visual packaging of the channel.



Main Tasks:



1. Long-Form Editing

In terms of style, I'm NOT looking for "retention editing" or flashy visuals. Instead, the goal of the editor is to improve comprehension. This means using visuals, text overlays, motion graphics, B-roll and so on that helps the viewer to understand the concepts that are being shared. The goal isn't purely to create an engaging video. Visuals and editing are also there to support the education and help the viewer to understand it.



This is a job with high creative freedom. I am the voice of my channel and content, but you are the visual director. You are free to bring up your own ideas and d
 on what you believe to be the best way of illustrating points. 



On average, my videos are around 10 to 15 minutes each, though some might be longer. And the volume I'm looking for is to put out two videos per week (8 per month).



2. Thumbnails

Help with the graphics for YouTube would be a huge help. Packaging is everything on this platform. The perfect candidate knows what draws people's attention and makes them click. For each edited video, you would design 1 to 3 thumbnails that go along with the video. 



3. Short form editing

Depending on available time, work would extend to editing for YouTube shorts as well. The editing for this is going to be faster paced editing. Edits would include captions, B-roll, graphics, overlays and so on.



The Perfect Candidate:



1. Understands Viewer & Platform Psychology

What makes someone click on a video thumbnail? How can you visually grab attention in the first few seconds? What keeps a viewer engaged throughout? How can visualize help the viewer with learning? Those are just a few things that go into into success on YouTube. The ideal candidate understands both the platform and how to keep the viewer engaged.



2. Has An Eye for Detail

This goes hand in hand with having pride in your work. There are many details that can make or break a video. You understand this and strives for excellence. And you take ownership so that even the small details are done well. You are someone who doesn't feel comfortable with delivering something that is worse than what you know you're capable of. 



3. Uses Clear Communication

We are a team with the goal of helping men through content. If you are stuck, tell me or ask for help. If you have a better idea than mine, share it. If you're running behind on schedule or need some time of, communicate it in advance. Anything is solvable, but clear communication is required for a good partnership.



4.   Is Reliable

Ideally, I'm looking for someone who can work alongside me for the long run and can grow with me as the channel grows. You are someone that I can count on. 



How to Apply:

If you've read this far, please follow these steps to apply. These questions help me in gauging how well you've read this job posting and your understanding of it. Generic messages that look like ChatGPT wrote them might be ignored. 



1. Mention "I am your teammate" in your initial message. 

2. Share some examples of videos that you have edited in the past.

3. Share a link to a long-form video (not yours) that you think best fits the style of edits that I described. Explain why you picked it. 



Looking forward to working with you!

Maikel

title: Customer Support Manager (DTC Supplement Brand)
description:
FULL-TIME, LONG-TERM, EXCLUSIVE ROLE ONLY

No part-time work, agency setups, or side commitments.



We are a fast-growing supplement brand looking for a Customer Support Manager who is genuinely obsessed with efficiency and continuous improvement. This is not a role for someone who just wants to maintain the status quo or follow a manual. We need a leader who looks at a process and immediately thinks of three ways to make it faster, smarter, and better.

You will be responsible for building and scaling our support operations. We want someone who takes deep pride in ownership, turns chaos into systems, and ensures our customer experience is a competitive advantage. If you are a builder who thrives on fixing broken workflows and implementing high-level strategy, we want to talk to you.



What You Will Do



* Optimize & Implement: You will be the architect of our CS roadmap, constantly auditing and improving systems to ensure we stay ahead of our growth.

* System Ownership: Beyond just managing tickets, you will create, improve, and maintain our entire library of SOPs, macros, and internal documentation.

* Problem Identification: You will proactively identify patterns in customer friction and work across departments to solve issues at the root.

* Tech Stack Management: Take full ownership of our tools (Gorgias, Shopify, etc.), ensuring all automations, rules, and integrations are running at peak performance.

* Accountability: Own the department KPIs (CSAT, Resolution Time, Efficiency) and use data to drive every decision you make.

* Hiring: Hire, promote, and remove underperformers to maintain a high-output, accountable team culture

* Lead by Example: Set the standard for communication and problem-solving, eventually leading the hiring and training as the team scales.



Qualifications



* 5+ years leading customer service teams of 15+ in a fast-paced eCommerce environment

* Obsession with Improvement: You must be able to demonstrate how you have personally improved a system, workflow, or department in a previous role.

* Shopify Expert: Strong hands-on experience with Shopify and its ecosystem of apps.

* Tool Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Gorgias, Zendesk, or similar platforms, specifically in building out automations and complex workflows.

* Strategic Thinker: Ability to translate raw data into actionable process changes.

* Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English with the ability to lead with authority and clarity.

* Commitment: Willingness to commit full-time and exclusively to our brand for the long term.



This Role is Not for You If:



* You view this as "just a job" rather than something you take personal pride in building

* You need step-by-step direction and shy away from strategic decisions

* You're uncomfortable holding people accountable or addressing underperformance

* You present problems instead of solving them

* You want a comfortable, predictable 9-to-5 job



Click here to apply : 
/jobs/
customer-support-manager

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



In this role, you won't just manage a calendar; you’ll be an integral part of a team growing Korean brands. We are looking for a proactive professional who treats the CEO’s goals as their own. This is a long-term, full-time commitment for someone who wants to move beyond administrative support and become an integral part of a fast-growing, international organization.



Key Responsibilities:



- Manage and optimize the CEO’s schedule, meetings, and calendar prioritizing engagements across multiple time zones (KR, SG, PH, MY).

- Coordinate domestic, international travel, including visas, multi-city itineraries, and ground logistics for regional brand events.

- Handle confidential information with absolute discretion.

- Prepare reports, presentations, and executive correspondence.

- Serve as a primary point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders.

- Coordinate board meetings, leadership meetings, and follow-ups.

- Track action items and ensure timely execution of priorities.

- Support strategic initiatives and special projects as assigned.

- Manage expenses, reimbursements, and basic administrative reporting.

- Support HR functions including recruitment, onboarding, employee documentation, and maintaining personnel records.

- Other adhoc tasks as assigned.



Qualifications:



- 2-5 years of experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, HR Admin or similar role.

- Experience supporting leadership within a Singaporean, Korean or multi-cultural corporate environment.

- Familiar with Korean Top Brands and international retail industries.

- Proficient with International Shopee, Lazada, Tiktok, and Big Seller.

- Advance proficiency in Google Workspace, Canva and project management software.

- Exceptional organizational, time-management, and multitasking skills.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

description:

We are hiring a senior E-commerce Manager to own and manage the majority of our digital business. This role is ideal for someone with a strong small business background who is comfortable leading a lean team, managing day to day operations, and stepping into the details when needed.



This is a hands on leadership role. We are not looking for a high level executive who operates far from execution. We are looking for someone who can lead, manage, and do..

We are supporting a privately owned company that distributes marine dock parts and supplies, with a strong and growing e-commerce operation in Florida. The business serves both B2B and B2C customers and relies heavily on its digital channels to drive sales, support customer experience, and scale efficiently across domestic and international markets.

Comfort managing integrations, apps, and technical workflows

Experience working with agencies and external partners

Education & Experience

Nice to Have Skills

title: High-Level Executive Assistant / Right Hand to the CEO (Remote)
description:
The Role:

We are a growing startup seeking a proactive Executive Assistant to serve as the "right hand" to the CEO. We aren't looking for someone to just follow a checklist; we need a partner who can manage the CEO’s life, gatekeep their time, and own administrative operations so the CEO can focus on high-level growth.



The Mission:

Your goal is to "buy back" the CEO's time. You will step in to handle the day-to-day logistics, ensuring the CEO focuses only on what moves the needle for the business.



Key Outcomes & Responsibilities:

* Gatekeeping: You are the guardian of the CEO’s focus. You manage the calendar and the inbox. You d
 what gets through to him and what gets handled by you.

* Inbox Management: You will own the CEO’s inbox. Your goal is Inbox Zero. You will draft responses, filter spam, and flag only the urgent items that need personal attention.

* Calendar Tetris: Protect the CEO’s time. Schedule meetings, buffer deep work sessions, and ensure there are no scheduling conflicts.

* Customer Success: Act as the first line of defense for customer inquiries, handling service requests with empathy and speed.

* Marketing Operations: You will take content concepts and video recordings, repurpose them using AI and SOPs, and schedule them for social media (Buffer) and newsletters (Kit).

* Financial Admin: Organize receipts, track expenses, and assist with basic invoicing.



The Tech Stack:

You must be proficient with:

* Communication: Slack, Gmail (Advanced filtering/labels), Google Meet

* Operations: Google Drive, Google Docs/Sheets, Google Calendar

* Creative/Marketing: Kit (formerly ConvertKit), Buffer, Canva

* AI tools: ChatGPT, Claude



You are the ideal candidate if:

* You have excellent written English and can mimic the CEO’s voice.

* You are tech-savvy and can figure out new software without hand-holding.

* You are thick-skinned, adaptable, and don't need to be micro-managed.

* You are very well organized and detail-oriented.

* You have a dedicated workspace with Fiber internet and Backup Power.



This is NOT for you if:

* You need to be told exactly what to do every single day.

* You disappear for hours without communication.

* You are uncomfortable giving feedback to the CEO (I need you to tell me when I’
ssing up the systems).



Details:

* Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 08:00–16:00 GMT.

* Philippine Time: 4:00 PM to 12:00 MN PHT (No Graveyard shift!)

* Location: 100% Remote.

* Salary: $1,400 USD / Month.



How to Apply (Read Carefully):

To ensure you are detail-oriented, please follow these steps exactly:

1. Please apply using 3 apply points.

title: CPA/Bookkeeper
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented Certified Public Accountant (CPA) who is not afraid to roll up their sleeves and handle full-cycle bookkeeping. This is not just a data-entry role; we need a financial partner who can manage our entire set of books in QuickBooks Online, handle complex journal entries, and produce accurate, high-level financial reporting every month.

If you are a CPA who excels at maintaining clean books, managing month-end closes, and generating financial insight, we want to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities



1. Full-Cycle Bookkeeping & General Ledger Management

Manage day-to-day accounting operations in QuickBooks Online (QBO).

Prepare and post standard and complex journal entries (accruals, deferrals, depreciation, etc.).Perform weekly bank and credit card reconciliations to ensure all transactions are captured accurately.

Maintain the Chart of Accounts and ensure proper classification of expenses and revenue.2. Financial Reporting & Analysis

Prepare and generate monthly financial statements, including Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statements.

Provide variance analysis and financial commentary on monthly results.

Ensure all reporting is GAAP/IFRS compliant (as applicable).3. Month-End & Year-End Close

Own the "Close Ends" process: Strict adherence to month-end closing timelines.

Review general ledger accounts for errors and omissions before closing the books.

Assist with year-end financial preparation and tax-ready reporting.



Requirements



Education/Certification: Must be a licensed CPA (Certified Public Accountant).Software Expertise: Advanced proficiency in QuickBooks Online is non-negotiable. You must know how to navigate QBO efficiently.

Experience: 3+ years of hands-on experience in full-cycle accounting, bookkeeping, and financial reporting.

Technical Skills: Strong understanding of debits/credits, journal entries, and accounting principles.

Soft Skills: Excellent attention to detail, strong English communication skills (written and verbal), and the ability to work independently without micromanagement.



Why Join Us?

Competitive Pay: Monthly salary of $2,000 USD

Stability: Long-term remote position with a growing business.

Autonomy: We trust you to manage the books and reporting processes.



***Very Important: Do take note that the applicant is required to share their updated CV with appropriate access. Applicants who are non compliant with this will be automatically ignored.***

title: Creative Photoshop / Media Specialist (Art Mockups)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Photoshop professional to create high-quality, realistic art mockups and prepare complete image sets for our e-commerce art products. This role is fully focused on visual quality, realism, and consistency, working within a clear SOP and fixed production standards.



You will be responsible for creating realistic interior mockups, white background images, stretched-out artwork images, and close-up detail shots. Each product requires a complete and correctly ordered image set that is ready for direct use in product creation and online sales.



A key part of this role is adding realistic frames to artworks when frame images are not provided. Frames must always match the actual options we offer. Guessing, inventing styles, sizes, or finishes is not acceptable. If something is unclear or missing, we expect you to flag it rather than make assumptions.



Strong attention to lighting, shadows, scale, color accuracy, and overall realism is essential. All mockups must visually match real-world proportions and product configurations. Images must be resized to 1200 × 1200 (1:1) and prepared according to our image standards.



This is not a graphic design or social media role. We are looking for someone with strong Photoshop compositing skills, experience with realistic interior and art mockups, and the ability to follow strict SOPs consistently. Precision, repeatability, and visual judgment matter more than speed.



Your work directly impacts product quality, brand perception, and conversion rates. If you enjoy creating clean, realistic, production-ready visuals and are comfortable working within structured workflows, we would love to hear from you.



Hiring Process:

Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a small paid evaluation task as part of the selection process.

title: Full Stack Developer - Laravel, Intertia, React, PHP
description:
Full Stack Developer (Laravel + React + Inertia)

The Opportunity



We are looking for a Product-Minded Full Stack Developer to join our team. You will be building a modern, monolithic application using the LILT stack (Laravel, Inertia, React, Tailwind).



We value developer velocity and type safety. We don’t use a separate API unless necessary; instead, we leverage Inertia.js to build a seamless Single Page Application (SPA) feel with the routing and productivity of a classic Laravel backend.



Our Tech Stack



- Core: Laravel 11, PHP 8.x



- Frontend: React (Hooks, Context), Inertia.js



- Language: TypeScript (Strict typing across the full stack)



- Styling: Tailwind CSS



- Infrastructure & Reliability: Redis, Laravel Horizon, Sentry



What You’ll Do



- Build End-to-End Features: Architect and implement features from the database migration to the React component, ensuring a snappy, reactive user experience.



- Manage Asynchronous Workflows: You won't just run everything in the request cycle. You will utilize Laravel Jobs and Redis to handle triggers, notifications, and complex data processing in the background.



- Ensure System Reliability: Monitor and optimize application health using Laravel Horizon for queue management and Sentry for error tracking. You’ll be responsible for debugging failed jobs and maintaining a clean error log.



- Maintain Data Integrity: Implement audit logging (e.g., Laravel Auditing) to track critical user actions and data changes for security and debugging.



- Write Clean, Type-Safe Code: Maintain high standards with strict TypeScript on the frontend and solid object-oriented design patterns on the backend.



What We’re Looking For



- Laravel Mastery: You are comfortable with Eloquent, Service Classes, Policies, and sophisticated database migrations.



- Modern Frontend Skills: You know React beyond the basics. You understand hooks, state management, and how to create reusable UI components with Tailwind CSS.



- Inertia.js Experience: You understand how Inertia acts as the glue between the server and client, avoiding the complexity of full REST/GraphQL APIs where they aren't needed.



- Production Experience with Queues: You have set up and managed Redis/Horizon in a production environment. You understand how to handle failed jobs, retries, and batching.



- Debugging & Auditing: You don't just fix bugs; you implement systems to catch them. You are familiar with error tracking flows and keeping audit trails for critical business logic.

title: Direct Response Video Editor
description:
We’re looking for a Direct Response Video Editor who understands one thing above all: ads that convert.



This isn’t about making things look pretty. It’s about crafting video creatives that stop the scroll, hold attention, and drive action — whether that’s a purchase, a lead, or a click. You’ll primarily produce UGC-style ads for paid social, but you’ll also work on VSLs, advertorials, product demos, testimonial mashups, and other high-converting ecommerce creatives.



If you think in terms of hooks, pattern interrupts, objection handling, and CTAs rather than just “nice transitions” — keep reading.



What You’ll Be Doing



Edit performance-driven UGC ads for Meta 
 & Instagram), TikTok, and YouTube — every frame needs a reason to exist - please make sure your application uses the word 'rich' in the 1st sentence or your application will be ignored.



Build VSLs and long-form sales videos for landing pages, funnels, and advertorials that guide viewers from problem to purchase



Create multiple hook variations, CTA swaps, and creative iterations for systematic A/B testing and scaling



Transform raw creator footage, testimonials, screen recordings, and product B-roll into persuasive narratives with clear direct response structure



Add strategic text overlays, captions, callouts, and motion graphics that reinforce the sales message — not just decorate



Edit with platform-native aesthetics: TikTok ads should feel like TikTok, IG Reels like Reels — not polished commercials



Collaborate with the creative strategist and media buyer to analyze what’s working, iterate on winning creatives, and kill what’s not working



Study top-performing ads in libraries (Meta Ad Library, TikTok Creative Center) and reverse-engineer what makes them convert



Deliver fast — the paid media world moves quickly and winning creative windows are short



What Makes a Great Editor



You Must Have:



Proven track record editing direct response ads — UGC ads, VSLs, or paid social creatives that actually ran and performed

A portfolio of ad work (not cinematic reels, not vlogs — we want to see ads that sold products)

Deep understanding of Ads frameworks: hook ? problem ? agitate ? solution ? proof ? CTA

Instinct for pacing and retention — you know when viewers drop off and how to prevent it

Proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve (After Effects, CapCut, or similar as secondary tools)

Ability to edit native-feeling content across formats and aspect ratios (9:16, 1:1, 16:9)

Strong caption and text overlay game — clean, readable, strategically timed

Fast turnaround without sacrificing quality — you can ship a solid 30–60s ad within 24 hours



Bonus Points If You

Have worked directly with media buyers and understand metrics like CTR, hook rate, hold rate, thumbstop ratio, and ROAS

Can write or improve ad copy, hooks, and CTAs — not just edit what’s handed to you

Have experience with info product launches, coaching funnels, or supplement/DTC brands

Know how to build urgency, stack social proof, and handle objections through editing choices

Can create basic motion graphics, lower thirds, and kinetic typography

Have experience with long-form VSLs (10–30+ minutes) with slide-based or hybrid formats

Understand the difference between a brand ad and a direct response ad — and why that matters



Creative formats you'll work on:

UGC Ads, VSLs, Testimonial Mashups, Product Demos, Advertorials Videos etc

title: Strategic Alibaba Sourcing & Procurement Specialist
description:
We are looking for an experienced Sourcing & Procurement Specialist to handle our supply chain operations on Alibaba. Your main goal is to find the best manufacturers, negotiate the best possible terms, and ensure that every product that leaves China meets our high-quality standards.



You will report directly to our Operations Manager and work closely with the CEO.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Supplier Vetting: Identify and verify manufacturers on Alibaba (avoiding trading companies/middlemen).



Negotiation: Negotiate pricing, MOQs (Minimum Order Quantities), and payment terms (aiming for 30/70 splits via Trade Assurance).



Sample Management: Coordinate sample production and shipping to ensure they meet specifications.



Quality Control: Arrange third-party inspections and ensure all production issues are fixed before final payment.



Logistics Coordination: Work with freight forwarders to ensure timely delivery and correct documentation.



Required Qualifications:



Min 2-3 years of experience specifically in Alibaba sourcing for international markets.



Expertise in Trade Assurance, Incoterms (EXW, FOB, DDP), and factory audits.



Deep understanding of Quality Control (QC) processes.



Strong negotiation skills – you must be comfortable pushing back on suppliers to get better deals.



Highly organized with a "never trust, always verify" mindset.



Why Work With Us?

title: Communication Manager (Content, Catalogs & Growth)
description:
We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Communication Manager to bridge the gap between our products and our customers. Your mission is to take the product information from our sourcing team and transform it into professional catalogs, high-converting website content, and clear brand communication.



You will report to the Operations Manager and ensure that our brand looks premium and professional across all platforms.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Content Creation: Write compelling product descriptions that sell. No generic text – we need benefits-driven copy.



Catalog Management: Design and update professional B2B/B2C catalogs (using Canva, Adobe, or similar tools).



E-commerce Development: Manage and update website content (Shopify, WooCommerce, or similar), ensuring all listings are optimized and visually appealing.



Asset Coordination: Work with the Sourcing Specialist to get high-quality product photos and videos. If the quality is low, you must provide feedback and creative direction.



Brand Voice: Ensure all communications 
s, newsletters, website) are consistent and professional.



Required Qualifications:



Excellent English: Near-native written English is a must. You should be able to write persuasively.



Design Skills: Experience with Canva is mandatory. Experience with Adobe Suite (Photoshop/InDesign) is a huge plus.



E-commerce Experience: You have previously managed product listings and website content.



Visual Eye: You can tell the difference between a "good" and a "great" product photo.



Organization: Ability to manage multiple product lines and deadlines simultaneously.



Why Work With Us?



Long-term, full-time career opportunity.



A chance to shape the visual identity of a growing brand.



Supportive management and a clear workflow.



HOW TO APPLY:



Change the subject line of your application to: "Creative Communicator for Aromika".



Include a link to your Portfolio (Catalogs you have designed or Websites you have managed). Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



Include a link to your Loom video (max 2 minutes) explaining your process: How do you turn a raw product photo and a list of features into a professional catalog page?



Tell us which e-commerce platform (Shopify, Magento, etc.) you are most comfortable with.

title: Instagram Outreach VA
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented, process-driven Instagram Outreach VA to help us license content from social media creators. This is a fully remote role, with full training provided. No prior experience required — we hire for attitude and train for skill.



---

About the Role



As a Instagram Outreach VA, you’ll be responsible for spotting viral, interesting, or newsworthy content on Instagram and other social platforms, reaching out to creators for permission, and organizing licensed content in Trello for our team. You’ll work closely with our existing tea
mbers and leverage tools like Claude Bot to make outreach and content licensing efficient.



This is a process-driven role, so attention to detail, reliability, and strong communication are essential.



---

Key Responsibilities



- Browse Instagram and other social media platforms to identify viral, newsworthy, or interesting content that matches our Ideal Customer Profile (ICP)

- Evaluate and select content worth licensing

- Send outreach messages (DMs) to creators using pre-written scripts and Claude Bot templates

- Handle creator responses and negotiations professionally

- Work toward securing permission to use content

- Organize and track content in Trello according to our workflow

- Submit daily reports and communicate progress with the team



---



Daily Tasks



? Find trending or high-quality content that fits our ICP



? Add potential content to Trello with all relevant details



? Send DMs to creators using pre-written templates



? Personalize messages slightly when appropriate



? Respond to creator questions using Claude Bot-generated responses



? Follow up to obtain content licensing approvals



? Update trackers and report daily progress



---



Who We’re Looking For



- Highly detail-oriented and organized

- Quick and clear communicator

- Reliable and consistent in following processes

- Comfortable researching and messaging creators on social media

- Motivated to work in a long-term, stable role

- Strong written English skills



---



Requirements



- Fast and stable internet connection

- Laptop or computer

- Comfortable with daily communication

- Full-time availability

- Ability to follow scripts and instructions exactly



---



Skills (Required)



- English – Writing

- Social Media Research

- Data Entry



---



Compensation & Benefits



???? $600/month



???? Paid time off



? Flexible working hours



???? Full training provided



???? Opportunity for long-term growth



---



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



To confirm you read the full job post, please follow these instructions exactly:



1. Subject line: Instagram Outreach VA – [YOUR NAME]

2. Answer the following in your message:

    - Why do you think you’re a good fit for this role?

    - Confirm that you agree to the fixed salary of $600/month

    - What other jobs do you currently have (if any)?

    - Have you ever used Instagram or other social media platforms for work?

    - Include your resume

    - Include the word “OUTREACH” at the bottom of your application



Applications that do not follow these instructions will be deleted — attention to detail is part of the job.

title: [Experienced] Creative Strategist (Direct Response & Brand)
description:
You are an experienced Creative Strategist.

- Suggesting new hooks, structures, and concepts for both static and video ads
