team, providing MI (including budgets and forecasts) and enabling decision making through financial analysis and

insight. You will be part of a team developing the business’s MI reporting suite and producing the business’s annual 

financial budget & forecasts.



Key Accountabilities:

• Financial analysis

     o Conducting in-depth financial analysis to provide contract insight & support operational decision-making

     o Understanding of contracts being billed including revenue & cost drivers to bridge Margin performance

     o Revenue reporting ensuring accurate & maximised billing is reflected

     o Cost reporting through analysis of payroll & consumables with detailed understanding of variances to 

         budget



• Management Information to deadlines

     o Client/site P&Ls with variance reporting highlighting risks & opportunities to profitability

     o Supporting leadership to understand margins & profitability for all clients and sites within BU

     o Establishing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and developing reporting suite through 

         utilisation of PowerBI



• Business Partnering

     o Working with Operational leads to ensure understanding of margin erosion where applicable and support 

         in any remedial strategies

     o Forecasting any additional revenues and margins

     o Business cases for additional spend and tracking performance to budget

     o Collate and track risks and opportunities to client forecasts 



Skills & Qualities and Experience:

• At least 2+ years' experience in a financial analysis/management accounting role

• Qualified/Part Qualified accountant (ACA/CIMA/ACCA) or QBE

• Highly skilled in Excel functionality & PowerBi

• Able to manage numerous Contracts 

• Excellent attention to detail

• Analytical skills to aid in the review of data

• Able to work to tight and strict deadlines

• Ambitious and enthusiastic towards both your career and projects

• Ability to challenge positively and debate confidently.

• Ability to work openly and collaboratively at all levels

title: Operations & Systems Coordinator
description:
About the Role 



Reports to: Founder / Chief Revenue Officer 



Our client is seeking an Operations & Systems Coordinator to support a growing luxury short-term rental (STR) portfolio in Austin, Texas. We are looking for an “orchestrator”, someone who thrives on building order from chaos, documenting workflows, and helping a founder step out of day-to-day operations. 







You won’t just execute tasks; you will design and improve the infrastructure that makes this business scalable. This role is ideal for a proactive professional who wants to grow into an operational leadership position. 







What You’ll Own 



Systems & SOP Development (Primary Focus) 



Process Documentation: Turn task notes into clean, usable SOPs and checklists for guest experience and property ops. 

Optimization: Identify inefficiencies and proactively recommend workflow improvements. 

Tracking: Build and maintain simple systems (vendor trackers, maintenance logs, escalation dashboards). 

AI Integration: Support the implementation of AI-assisted workflows and operational automation. 



Vendor Coordination & Property Operations 



Scheduling: Coordinate cleaners, maintenance, and specialty vendors (pool, landscaping, etc.). 

Communication: Use text/email for efficiency; make phone calls to US vendors when speed is required. 

Quality Control: Maintain vendor notes, pricing, and performance tracking. 

Triage: Handle maintenance troubleshooting and ensure timely resolutions. 



Guest Operations & Tech Management 



System Oversight: Manage AI messaging tools (Hospitable, HostBuddy) to ensure concierge-level service. 

Escalations: Professionally handle high-risk guest situations and flag risks before they affect reviews. 

Knowledge Base: Maintain property FAQs and internal reference guides. 



Admin & Financial Support 



Daily Reporting: Send structured daily summaries highlighting progress and bottlenecks. 

Finance: Support basic workflows, including vendor payments and expense tracking in QuickBooks. 

Growth: Assist with CRM hygiene (GoHighLevel/Vintory) and market research. 



Who This Role Is For 



You may be a strong fit if you:  



Have STR Experience: You understand the fast-paced nature of property management. 

Are a Systems Thinker: You have built or improved SOPs and workflows before. 

Communicate Confidently: Exceptional spoken and written English; comfortable calling US vendors. 

Are Proactive: You think three steps ahead rather than waiting for instructions. 

Are AI-Fluency: You use AI tools beyond basic prompts to summarize data and draft systems. 

Have High Discernment: You know when a process doesn't make sense and needs to be updated. 



Preferred Qualifications 



Hands-on experience with Hospitable (Highly Preferred). 

Experience managing or scaling a portfolio of multiple properties. 

Familiarity with QuickBooks, CRM platforms, or OpenPhone. 

Spanish fluency is a plus (for vendor coordination). 



What Success Looks Like Within 90 days: 



Vendor coordination runs smoothly with minimal founder involvement. 

A centralized "SOP Library" is documented and being utilized. 

Operational tasks are tracked in a clear, transparent dashboard. 

The founder is focused on growth and partnerships, confident that the "machine" is running. 



Compensation & Schedule 



Hourly Rate: $7-12/hr (based on experience) 

Schedule: Wednesday- Monday, aligned with peak guest stays and opportunity to increase hours as the business scales 

Full-Time: 30-40 hrs/week 



To apply, kindly fill out this form:

title: Media Buyer for 8-figure brand - Availability during US and/or EU time zones required
description:
Media Buyer Purpose

The Media Buyer at BECH & YD ECOM manages day-to-day Meta ad operations and makes data-driven decisions that drive revenue for our Shopify brands. You handle significant ad spend with precision, reliability, and accountability. You interpret and report performance data so the team can make fast and informed decisions. You work with the Strategist and Creative Team to launch ads quickly, follow our media buying systems, and ensure monthly performance targets are achieved. You must be available during US and/or EU operating hours for communication, optimizations, and reporting.



Media Buyer Primary Roles

* Launch weekly dynamic creative tests

* Scale budgets based on KPIs and our Scaling Process

* Attend performance calls

* Complete weekly and monthly data reports

* Use attribution tools and strategist input

* Communicate daily in Slack

* Share data-based ideas and concepts



Qualifications and Character Traits

Direct experience required:

* Meta ads setup and launch for Shopify brands

* Managing ad accounts spending above $1,000 per day

* Tracking setup and troubleshooting

* Data analysis and reporting

* Working in a team environment



Character expectations:

* Extreme attention to detail

* Fast-moving and working in US/EU hours

* Organized and punctual

* Efficient while willing to refine work

* Strong data interpretation and communication

* Reliable and accountable

* Proactive communicator

* Coachable and growth-oriented



Compensation

* $5 per hour starting rate

* Performance-based bonuses

* 6 days per week



Growth Potential

* Strong performance results in increased responsibility and higher compensation



Application Requirement

* Submit a 2–3 minute Loom video introducing yourself

* Explain why you are a strong fit

* Share one example of managing and scaling a Meta ad account

* Applications without a Loom video will not be considered

title: Customer Support QA Analyst - Ecommerce
description:
Remote | Full-Time | Philippines Only

$750 - $900 USD/month



 

At most eCommerce brands, QA Analysts are treated like human checklists.



You’re expected to audit 100+ tickets per day.



And watch your recommendations vanish while the same mistakes repeat endlessly.



Here, it's different.



You'll focus on quality over quantity—auditing strategically instead of rushing through 100+ tickets a day.



And you won't just catch mistakes. You'll help prevent them.



You’ll dig deeper to understand why things break:

— Why did this customer feel unheard?

— Why did our rep send a template instead of showing empathy?

— Why does our knowledge base fail customers?



Then work with our CS Team Lead to solve it—shaping training, resources, and SOPs based on what you found.



Your ideas will actually matter here.



So if you're someone who:

— Prides themselves on catching details others miss

— Wants to have real impact on customer experience

— Thrives in fast-paced startups, not stagnant corporate environments

— Wants to do work that matters—improving the health and wellness of families



This opportunity is for you.





About Us

We're a wellness brand helping parents navigate their children's health. These are delicate topics where a careless
 can break trust, but an empathetic response can earn it completely.



Unlike most eCommerce brands that treat support as a cost center, we see it as the core of our mission. Every interaction is a chance to help a worried parent feel heard, reassured, and confident in their decision.



Right now, we're at a critical point. We're scaling fast—aiming for 8 figures in our second year—and we refuse to let quality slip as we grow.



That's why we need a QA Analyst who ensures every customer interaction meets our standard—no matter how quickly we scale.





The Role: What You'll Own

As our QA Analyst, you'll ensure every customer interaction reflects our mission of empathy, clarity, and safety.



You'll partner directly with our Customer Support Team Lead to maintain quality standards while we scale.



Your Core Responsibilities:



1. Audit Customer Interactions

— Review support tickets to evaluate quality standards

— Look beyond compliance: Did we actually help this customer?

— Spot patterns in what's working and what's breaking



2. Calibration & Standards

— Align with Team Lead on what "world-class" customer experience looks like

— Ensure audits are fair, consistent, and tied to actual customer outcomes



3. Deliver Actionable Insights

— Turn audit findings into clear, specific feedback for Team Lead

— Don't just point out problems—show exactly what needs to change

— Enable better coaching by providing data that actually helps

— Close the feedback loop: Did the coaching work? Did the SOP update solve the problem?



4. Identify Trends & Recommend Fixes

— Spot recurring customer pain points or Knowledge Base gaps

— Recommend SOP updates that prevent issues from repeating





What We're Looking For

We're not looking for a checkbox auditor who follows a script. 



We need a strategic thinker who can see the forest and the trees. [too metaphorical]



Must-Have Experience:

— 2+ years in Customer Support QA (eCommerce, wellness, or "high-empathy" industries preferred)

— Proficiency with helpdesk tools like Zendesk, Gorgias, or Help Scout

— Comfortable with project management tools like Notion, Asana, ClickUp, or Monday

— Exceptional written communication - you're auditing communication, so you need to be great at it

— You've improved QA processes before (not just followed someone else's playbook)



Must-Have Attributes:

— Fast Learner - Absorb product details, compliance guidelines, and brand voice quickly. Own —your workflow from day one.

— Self-Starter - Thrive in fast-paced environments. Navigate ambiguity with ease. Identify gaps and implement solutions without needing a step-by-step manual.

— Critical Thinker - Look beyond the surface to evaluate customer concerns objectively and ensure support remains world-class, empathetic, and mission-aligned.

— Detail-Obsessed - Notice the small things: a missed link, a typo, a tone that feels slightly off for a worried customer.

— Master of the Soft Skills - Understand the difference between "technically correct" and "actually helpful."





Compensation, Perks & Growth Path

Total Compensation: $750 - $900 USD/month

— Base Salary: $750/month

— Performance Bonus: Up to $150/month



Growth Path: Quality & Training Lead

— Design the full onboarding curriculum for our support team

— Build the global quality framework as we scale

— Train, manage, and develop a team of QA analysts



Professional Development

— Workshops, certifications, training - we'll support what you need to level up



Perks:

— Work with a mission-driven wellness brand making a real impact on families

— Small team = high visibility and meaningful influence

— Help build QA systems from the ground up at a fast-growing startup





Our Hiring Process:

1. Submit Application (linked below)

2. Loom Video Introduction

3. Technical Assessment

4. Interview with Customer Service Team Lead

5. Final Interview with our CEO

6. Reference Check





Our Core Values

Which one speaks to you most? Include it in your application.

MOVE FAST - Always prioritize quality, but do so with speed

WORLD CLASS - We expect excellence & reject mediocrity

GO ONE MORE - Win. Celebrate it. Then beat it.





We're building the #1 customer experience in the wellness space—and we need a QA Analyst who protects our standards and pushes them higher.



If you're ready to do work that actually matters with a team that cares as much as you do, hit apply.

title: Marketing Manager / Assistant to CMM
description:
I am looking for an assistant who is very organised and can help me care for these major marketing tasks:



- Care for marketing clients and project manage supporting them

- Deal with sales inquiries of new clients

- Research new investments and real estate projects (we have many clients in this field and are looking to get more)

- Check
 ads account for errors, look for opportunities to improve accounts

- Check Google ads account for errors, look for opportunities to improve accounts

- Check shopify website for issues each day

- Check slack messages to see if anything is pending for me to do

- Help me stay on top of my tasks in general and help me not forget things

- Understands SEO and can help project manage SEO for clients

- Has a good eye for design, as much of my work is also approving ads, videos and design work. i will need your help with this.



There is a really broad range of tasks you will learn to do, all of which will be easy to do and exciting for someone who is really organised, has attention to detail and can think creatively.



The hard part about this job is you need to be a numbers person, but also have an eye for design and symmetry.



Your level of english needs to be very fluent, good phone conversation level.

You will be working 40 hours per week, Perth Australia time zone.



PLEASE BEWARE: If you intend of working more than 1 job simultaneously, or are even slightly distracted and seem to be doing other things, we will assume you are not working full time for us. You will be terminated immediately. So please only apply if you intend on being honest and working this 1 job and giving it your all.



To apply for this job, please record a video of yourself telling me what experience you have and why you think you would be a reliable person to work with.

title: Credit Officer & Loan Processor
description:
About the Role



The client is an integrated residential property business, working hand in hand with their clients to provide property buying, advisory and management services, and investment funds. As a Credit Officer & Loan Processor, you will play a key role in supporting the end-to-end loan lifecycle — from credit assessment through to settlement and post-closing activities.



This is a combined role responsible for reviewing and assessing loan applications in line with company credit policy, while also managing the operational processing and documentation requirements of each loan. You will work closely with clients, brokers, sales teams, and internal operations stakeholders to ensure applications are assessed accurately, processed efficiently, and maintained in full compliance with responsible lending regulations. If you are highly detail-oriented, analytical, and thrive in a fast-paced financial services environment, we’d love to meet you.







Key Responsibilities



Credit Assessment



Review all loan applications and assess suitability in accordance with internal credit policy.

Analyse financial information and supporting documentation to determine applicant eligibility.

Complete formal credit assessments and provide recommendations to the GM – Deployment.

Ensure sound credit decision-making aligned with responsible lending standards.



Loan Processing & Operations



Support the end-to-end loan application process from submission to settlement.

Complete accurate data entry and maintain updated loan files.

Order property valuations and gather required supporting documentation.

Prepare loan files for assessment and approval.



Loan Documentation Management



Prepare, manage, and track loan documentation.

Ensure all required documents are accurate, compliant, and complete.

Obtain required signatures and submit applications correctly and within required timelines.



Stakeholder Liaison



Coordinate with clients, brokers, sales teams, and operations tea
mbers to progress applications.

Provide clear and timely updates on loan status.

Proactively identify and resolve issues that may delay approvals or settlements.



Compliance & Legal Requirements



Ensure all activities comply with responsible lending regulations and internal compliance standards.

Maintain accurate and compliant loan records.

Support brokers with internal compliance documentation requirements.



Customer Service



Respond promptly to customer inquiries and provide professional, helpful support.

Build and maintain strong client relationships throughout the loan process.

Deliver a high level of service to both internal and external stakeholders.



Post-Closing Activities



Follow up on loan lodgements and settlement progress.

Process loan discharges and organise settlements in accordance with procedures.

Assist with servicing calculations and operational loan tasks as required.



System & Database Maintenance



Maintain accurate client records within CRM/database systems.

Ensure all documentation is uploaded and tracked appropriately.

HubSpot experience is highly regarded.



Other Responsibilities



You will coordinate with the Property Management Team to ensure that requests and concerns are properly addressed.

Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned by the client later on.



About You



Fluent written and spoken English.

At least 3–5 years’ experience in credit assessment, loan processing, or financial services roles.

Strong understanding of responsible lending regulations and credit policy frameworks.

Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail.

Ability to manage multiple applications and deadlines simultaneously.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Experience in residential property lending or mortgage processing is highly regarded.

HubSpot or CRM experience is a plus.

Proactive, organised, and solutions-focused mindset.



Finer Details



Schedule: 7am - 4pm PHT, Mon - Fri



Start Date: TBD

title: Video Editing Virtual Assistant
description:
Currently looking for a virtual assistant to do video editing of product review videos that I create for my Amazon Storefront and new YouTube channel.



The first month would expect around 12 hours a week. This could increase to 20 hours a week after the first month or even sooner if things go well.



Prefer editing done in CapCut using a Thumbnail I already have created in Canva. You would simply export a still image from the video and insert it into the Canva thumbnail.



I also am starting to create UGC videos for brands and we could include editing of those videos at some point if I get busier, but for now it would just be the Amazon product review videso!



Let me know how you think you could work within my needs and if you are flexible on hours. I would start off with expecting at least 12 hours per week.



Thank you for your interest!  Gina

title: Senior Business Development Manager, Manila/Bulacan
description:
About TrustClub

TrustClub is an invite-only trust network that allows strangers to trust each other and helps businesses reduce risk and increase profitability. Members earn and use Trust Points to access services, loans, jobs and other opportunities.

We are a UK based technology startup business with the goal of creating a global network of trusted members who do better in life, because others can trust them. We are growing our network in the Philippines and seeking local managers to drive adoption.



Currently backed by Antler UK. 



Role

You will build partnerships and recruit members to TrustClub in Bulacan first, then train local teams, move on to other Provinces within the Philippines and in the future, potentially abroad.



The role requires entrepreneurial drive and the ability to pitch and teach how a high trust environment benefits communities and businesses.



Key Responsibilities

Oversee onboarding local businesses and community leaders as TrustClub partners

Represent TrustClub at local events and organise events for TrustClub

Oversee onboarding of new members and teaching of the Trust Principles

Train local teams, first in Bulacan then in other provinces in the Philippines & abroad

Collect feedback from users and help shape TrustClub’s strategy



Requirements

Fluent in English, both spoken and written

Based in Manila or Bulacan, with knowledge of business networks and communities

Proven entrepreneurial mindset; ideally has run or managed a business

5 Years of experience in business development or sales

Self-starter who can operate with minimal supervision (very important, we want proactive people)

Bonus: Familiarity with lending, microfinance, BNPL, or community financing



Work Setup and Compensation

Base stipend: Php 30,000/month to 60,000/month

Commission income: Potential for additional Php 80,
,000/month

Includes flexible work-from-home, field work in the province and calls at evening hours



Send your application to

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager 

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager 

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours  



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision 

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business. 



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us! 



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager. 



 Role Purpose 

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling. 



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role. 



What Success Looks Like 

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it. 



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth. 



Primary Objectives 

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights 

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages 

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy 

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS 



Regular Work Activities 

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards 

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning 

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights 

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic 

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding 

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements 

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards 

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts 

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals 

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data 

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows 

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules 

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads 

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability 

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality 



Key Skills 

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows) 

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD) 

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills 

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management 

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS 

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills 

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability 

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast 

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams 

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques 



People Contacts and Interactions 

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap 

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs 

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy 

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews 



Role Requirements 

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns 

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards) 

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments 

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones 

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets 

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting 

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization 

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership 

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing 



How to Apply:

Click the link - 

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To: CEO

Work Hours: Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data — not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

• Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

• Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

• Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

• Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.



Regular Work Activities

• Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

• Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

• Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

• Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

• Reconcile inbound placement fees

• Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

• Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

• Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

• Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

• Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

• Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

• Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

• Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

• Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

• Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

• Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

• Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

• Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

• Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

• Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

• Advanced spreadsheet skills

• Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

• Strong analytical and investigative mindset

• High attention to detail

• Ability to reconcile complex datasets

• Process-driven

• Cost-reduction oriented thinking

• Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions – What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

• Direct report to the CEO

• Frequent communication with

• Operations Team

• Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education

• 2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

• Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

• Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

• Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

• E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

• Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

• Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

• Strong personal accountability

• Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-AGUZM8V3D/landing?u=
ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

title: Growth Executive - Palayan/Cabanatuan
description:
**Important** - Must be based in these locations:



Cabanatuan. Palayan City, Laur and the other surrounding towns. 



About TrustClub



TrustClub is building a global network of trust – where reputation becomes currency.

We help people and small businesses access opportunities, loans, and partnerships based on trust, not paperwork.

We believe trust should be profitable, and that communities grow stronger when people vouch for each other.



Ultimately higher trust means people can work with each other more easily and everyone gets richer. This is true across the world and we are starting with the Philippines, one town at a time.



Your Mission



Be the face of TrustClub in your community. Inspire people to believe in trust again – show that keeping your word creates real opportunity. Grow local networks, onboard partners, and make “trust” go viral in your area.



Where we are currently:



We already have traction in Palayan City with a brilliant Growth Manager already doing great things, working closely with both business and political leaders across multiple communities. We are ambitious though and need another outgoing, organised and confident tea
mber to join us. We want to make the city and surrounding areas one of the great economic stories. With high trust between people and businesses, we believe everyone can end up richer, happier and more successful.



What You’ll Do



- Launch and grow local TrustClub communities

- Organize small events and tell inspiring local stories

- Onboard and build partnerships with small businesses and local leaders

- Build social media presence and engagement

- Share feedback to shape our growth playbook

- Help businesses grow with Loans & BNPL



You Might Be a Great Fit If You



- Are respected and well-connected in your community

- Believe deeply in fairness and cooperation

- Have experience in community building or local marketing

- Are active on social media and love storytelling

- Want to help people rise together through trust

- Good English



Success Looks Like (in one month)



- 1,000+ new members in your area

- 10+ local business partnerships

- Stories of trust that spread online



What We Offer



- Base pay plus growth bonuses

- Path to leadership

- The chance to change how the world measures trust

- The opportunity to change your region for the better





How to Apply



Send us:



A short note on how you believe we could change Palayan City for the better - please don't get chatGPT to write this

title: Technical SEO Specialist
description:
APPLICANTS WHO APPLY THROUGH THE LINK BELOW WILL BE SCREENED

***Only complete submissions will be considered.***



Join our growing team at gigCMO Ltd, a dynamic growth consultancy providing strategic marketing leadership and expertise to start-ups, scale-ups, and SMEs, propelling them toward profitable revenue growth. Nestled in the heart of the City of London, United Kingdom, we specialise in supporting B2B clients in expanding their reach domestically and internationally. Our dedicated team, operating under the banner of Magnacca International, is strategically based in the Philippines. We chose this location for its pool of talent, strong social skills, enthusiasm, and unwavering loyalty.



We are looking for a detail-oriented and technically skilled website auditor to identify and resolve site issues related to accessibility, performance, SEO, and security in WordPress, HubSpot, and Webflow. This role will be critical in ensuring our digital properties meet quality standards and provide excellent user experiences.



Responsibilities:

Perform regular technical audits of company websites built in WordPress, HubSpot, and Webflow platforms.

Identify issues related to site speed, broken links, ADA compliance, SEO optimization, and security vulnerabilities.

Diagnose and troubleshoot problems, then implement solutions and optimizations.

Run site audits using tools such as Lighthouse, Wave, SEMrush, Pingdom.

Create action plans and document all findings in audit reports.

Communicate identified problems and solutions to stakeholders.

Stay up-to-date with best practices and site standards.



Requirements:

2+ years conducting technical website audits.

Expert knowledge of WordPress, HubSpot, and Webflow platforms.

Experience using site auditing tools and Chrome DevTools.

Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.

Attention to detail with ability to follow audit protocols.

Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.

Knowledge of web development and SEO best practices.



Application Requirements: This role demands a full-time commitment and is not compatible with another full-time job. To be considered, kindly fill out the form using this link: https://gigcmo.typeform.com/jobpost

*Incomplete submission will not be considered*

*Please do not apply if you do not meet the above requirements*



This position offers an excellent opportunity to use your technical auditing skills and expertise in WordPress, HubSpot, and Webflow to directly enhance our web presence and user experiences. Qualified candidates should have a strong technical background conducting similar site audits and optimizations.



Compensation: Php 30,000 (depending on whether the applicant meets 100% of the requirements)

title: LinkedIn Engagement and Community Specialist
description:
Role Overview:



We are seeking a 
munity Manager with a proven track record to lead and enhance our social media presence on LinkedIn. This role is pivotal in driving brand visibility, fostering meaningful engagement, and contributing to business growth. You will work closely with our content and copywriting teams to transform content into engaging LinkedIn posts, strategically incorporating tags, hashtags, and other platform-specific features. If you are looking for a traditional "lead generation" role, this position is not for you.



Key Responsibilities:

Strategic Content Management: Collaborate with our content and copywriting teams to adapt and optimise content for LinkedIn, ensuring posts are engaging and aligned with our strategic goals. This includes selecting appropriate tags, hashtags, and other LinkedIn features to maximise reach and impact.

Engagement and Community Building: Actively engage with new and existing audiences by initiating conversations, tagging relevant individuals and organisations, and fostering meaningful interactions that drive brand awareness and community growth.

Trend Monitoring and Adaptation: Stay ahead of industry trends and LinkedIn platform updates, using insights to recommend new strategies and content formats that keep our brand relevant and engaging.

Performance Analysis: Regularly track and analyse LinkedIn metrics, providing actionable insights and reports to refine our content strategy and optimise engagement.

Collaborative Integration: Work seamlessly with internal teams to ensure LinkedIn initiatives align with broader marketing strategies, contributing to the overall success of our campaigns.

Profile Optimisation: Continuously review and optimise LinkedIn profiles to maximise visibility, reach, and impact across all our LinkedIn activities.

Responsive Communication: Manage inquiries and feedback on LinkedIn promptly and professionally, ensuring our community feels heard and valued.



Key Skills and Competencies:



LinkedIn Expertise: Deep understanding of LinkedIn’s platform features, tools, and best practices, with at least 2 years of professional experience managing LinkedIn accounts for businesses or clients.

Content Optimisation: Ability to work with content and copywriting teams to turn content into engaging LinkedIn posts, utilising tags, hashtags, and other features to enhance visibility.

Analytical Mindset: Proficient in using LinkedIn metrics and analytics to drive performance improvements and inform content strategies.

Collaborative Spirit: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, integrating LinkedIn efforts with broader marketing and business goals.

Proactive and Trend-Focused: A keen eye for spotting emerging trends on LinkedIn and the initiative to implement them in our strategies.

Strong Communication: Excellent written communication skills, with an emphasis on clarity, creativity, and attention to detail.

Organisational Skills: Capable of managing multiple tasks and projects simultaneously while maintaining a high level of quality and consistency.



Qualifications and Experience:



Professional Experience: Minimum of 2 years managing LinkedIn accounts for businesses or clients.

Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.

Platform Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of LinkedIn’s platform features, tools, and best practices.

Content Optimisation: Experience in adapting and optimising content for LinkedIn to enhance engagement.

Analytical Skills: Demonstrable experience with LinkedIn metrics and analytics for performance tracking and improvement.

*Incomplete submission will not be considered*

*Please do not apply if you do not meet the above requirements*

title: Product Manager - SaaS
description:
gigCMO is a dynamic growth consultancy providing strategic marketing leadership and expertise to start-ups, scale-ups, and SMEs, propelling them toward profitable revenue growth. Nestled in the heart of the City of London, United Kingdom, we specialise in supporting B2B clients in expanding their reach domestically and internationally. Our dedicated team, operating under the banner of Magnacca International, is strategically based in the Philippines. We chose this location for its pool of talent, strong social skills, enthusiasm, and unwavering loyalty.



We are seeking a dedicated and dynamic Product Manager to lead and enhance our Digital Church Platform®. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the product development lifecycle, managing development resources effectively, and ensuring rigorous final testing processes before releasing software updates. You will also play a critical role in translating the strategic vision held by the founder into actionable roadmaps and product deliverables.



Key Responsibilities:



- Manage the Product Development (PD) pipeline, ensuring alignment with organisational goals.

- Prioritise and allocate development resources efficiently to align with strategic priorities.

- Conduct comprehensive final testing and quality assurance to guarantee smooth, error-free software updates before public release.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to deliver product enhancements that meet user needs and drive platform adoption.

- Communicate clearly and proactively with stakeholders regarding project timelines, milestones, and release schedules.

- Translate strategic vision and high-level ideas from leadership into actionable product roadmaps, user stories, and specifications. 

- Facilitate clear and consistent communication between non-technical stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring all parties are aligned.

- Set up and manage internal systems (e.g. Basecamp and HubSpot) to track backlog, sprints, and milestones.

- Gather feedback from churches and users to shape future features and improvements. 

- Monitor product performance or user feedback loops to inform decisions and prioritisation. 

- Monitor incoming requests via helpdesk and chat channels, triage issues, and ensure timely resolution either directly or by coordinating with the development team.

title: Graphic Designer – Product Photography, Amazon Images, and Full-Service Visual Design
description:
I'm looking for a talented graphic designer who can take raw images and rough concepts and turn them into polished, professional visuals that actually sell. I work with physical products that need to look stunning online—and I need someone who can clean up product photos, remove backgrounds, swap colors to show different finishes, and make every image look like it came out of a professional studio. But that's just the starting point.



This role is about more than just photo editing. I need a designer who understands how visuals communicate, how to guide a buyer's eye, and how to make someone stop scrolling and pay attention. Whether it's a hero image on an Amazon listing, an infographic that explains a product's features at a glance, or a company catalog that makes our brand look polished and professional—I need someone who genuinely cares about the quality of the final product.



What I need you to be able to do:

Expert-level image editing in Photoshop, InDesign, Lightroom, Illustrator, or similar tools. You should be able to take a photo shot in less-than-ideal conditions and make it look studio-quality. Background removal is a core part of this role and needs to be clean and precise—no jagged edges, no obvious cutouts.



Product color variation editing—showing the same product in multiple finishes or colorways without a separate photoshoot for each one. If you know how to do this convincingly, that's a huge advantage.



Amazon listing image creation—you should understand what makes a main image convert, how to build an infographic that communicates value quickly, and how to put together a full image set including hero shots, lifestyle images, feature callouts, and comparison graphics.



Beyond product photography, I also need someone who handles the full range of graphic design work: catalogs and PDFs, logo design, website design assets, social media graphics, and anything else that falls under "this needs to look great."

What kind of person I'm looking for:



I want someone who has creative direction and brings their own eye to the work. If you see a better way to frame a product, a layout that communicates more clearly, or a color treatment that makes something pop—speak up. I'm not looking for someone who just executes instructions without thinking. I want a collaborator who cares about what the design is actually trying to accomplish.



You should be organized, self-directed, and able to manage multiple projects at once. I'll be sending raw assets and short briefs regularly (and sometimes it may be as simple as create a great looking presentation using these words and here are a few reference images), and I need to trust that you'll deliver on time without constant follow-up. If you're going to miss a deadline or run into a problem, communicate early—that's all I ask. I will be using a tool like trello to track projects and timelines. To confirm you've read this entire post, please use the subject line "Pickle" when you reach out.



Hours and availability:

This is a part-time position. I need you available Monday through Friday, 1:00pm–6:00pm Spain time (Madrid, GMT+1). I'm based in Spain, so being available during these hours is important for collaboration and quick turnarounds.



Pay and schedule:

All hours are tracked and calculated based on California time (GMT-8) for consistency with my other tea
mbers. I pay twice a month via Wise—on the 1st and 16th. The payment on the 16th covers work from the 1st–15th, and the payment on the 1st covers the 16th through the end of the month.



How to apply:

 me directly at 
 do not apply through the OnlineJobs.ph messaging system as I do not monitor those messages. If you have worked for a company like Design Pickle, that will be a huge bonus, as you are used to working with various projects at the same time.



Include your portfolio or work samples—before/after product photo edits are especially valuable. I want to see background removal work, color variation edits, Amazon listing images, and any other design work you're proud of.



As part of the process, I'll send you a test project using a real product image or brief. This is unpaid, but it's the only way for me to evaluate your skills and make sure we're a good fit before committing to work together. If that goes well, I will likely ask you to do a paid test so I can further evaluate your skill.



Looking forward to finding someone who can make every product and every brand asset look as good as it deserves to.



Please note: You must be based in the Philippines. If you are based elsewhere—India, Bangladesh, Pakistan, or anywhere outside the Philippines—please do not apply.

About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accounting Virtual Assistant to join our dynamic team. This role focuses on comprehensive financial management and accounting support, including UK-specific compliance requirements. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing accounts payable and receivable, ensuring regulatory compliance, and providing essential financial reporting to support our expanding operations across Ireland and the UK.



Key Responsibilities

Bookkeeping & Financial Data Management



Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for all business transactions

Data Entry: Process and record financial data with precision and attention to detail

Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and payment processing for clients and suppliers

Account Reconciliation: Reconcile bank statements and maintain accurate account balances

Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software including MYOB



Accounts Management



Accounts Payable: Manage supplier payments, vendor invoices, and payment scheduling

Accounts Receivable: Monitor client payments, follow up on outstanding invoices, and manage debt collection

Cash Flow Management: Track and report on cash flow positions and payment cycles

Credit Control: Implement credit control procedures and manage customer payment terms



UK Compliance & Regulatory Requirements



CIS Compliance: Manage Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) compliance and monthly reporting

VAT Returns: Prepare and submit VAT returns ensuring full compliance with HMRC requirements

Tax Compliance: Maintain compliance with all UK tax regulations and submission deadlines

HMRC Submissions: Handle various HMRC submissions and correspondence



Payroll & Employment Administration



Payroll Management: Process PAYE (Pay As You Earn) and CIS payroll for employees and subcontractors

Employment Records: Maintain accurate employment records and statutory documentation

Pension Administration: Support workplace pension scheme administration and compliance

Statutory Payments: Calculate and process statutory sick pay, maternity pay, and other employment-related payments



Financial Reporting & Analysis



P&L Preparation: Generate comprehensive Profit & Loss statements and financial reports

Financial Analysis: Provide financial analysis and insights to support business decision-making

Management Reporting: Prepare regular financial reports for management review

Budget Support: Assist with budget preparation and variance analysis



Tax Preparation & Professional Support



Tax Preparation: Prepare and organize documentation for annual tax returns and submissions

Professional Liaison: Work closely with external accountants and tax advisors

Audit Support: Provide documentation and support during audits and financial reviews

Compliance Monitoring: Ensure all financial practices meet regulatory standards



Required Skills & Experience



Essential Qualifications



UK Tax Knowledge: Strong understanding of UK tax system, VAT, CIS, and PAYE regulations

Construction Industry: Experience with construction industry accounting and CIS compliance preferred

Compliance Expertise: Knowledge of HMRC requirements and submission processes

Accounting Software: Proficiency in accounting software (Sage, Xero, QuickBooks, MYOB or similar platforms)



Application Instructions:

Application Instructions:

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Bookkeeper - Airbnb Property Management
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Virtual Assistant to support our bookkeeping and accounts payable operations for NC Stays. 

This role is critical to keeping our financial records accurate, contractors paid on time, budgets monitored, and owner statements reliable. 

You will work closely with our internal team, including Guest Services, to ensure expenses are properly documented, categorized, and tracked.

This position is ideal for someone who is organized, proactive, and comfortable working in accounting systems with minimal supervision.



Key Responsibilities

Accounts Payable 

Fully own Accounts Payable, ensuring same-day payment processing Monday–Friday via Topkey or sometimes Venmo.

Track due dates and prioritize urgent or time-sensitive payments

Communicate clearly with internal team regarding payment status

Ensure bills are paid and categorized to correct property/owner so that owner statements are accurate 

Run monthly payroll via Gusto



Budget & Expense Tracking

Review budget vs. actuals for NC Stays on a regular basis

Identify variances, unusual spending, or inconsistencies and flag them for review

Expense Categorizing

Follow up with internal tea
mbers that didn’t input 

Identify variances, unusual spending, or inconsistencies and flag them for review



Track Onboarding expenses and revenue

Track onboarding expenses for new properties to ensure costs are complete, accurate, and properly categorized. And ensure they’re profitable at least by 10%.  

Invoicing clients 



Owner Statement Review

Review owner statements for accuracy and completeness

Identify and flag discrepancies, missing charges, or misclassifications

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to resolve issues before statements are finalized

Ensure statements are clean and have consistent nomenclature across all properties (For example - Supplies - Consumables. Or Supplies - New Trash Can. 



Transaction Categorization

Accurately categorize transactions. Including splitting transactions by property 

Ensure expenses and payments are coded consistently and correctly

Follow up with internal tea
mbers that didn’t input correct property or category on a daily basis

Maintain clean books by resolving uncategorized items promptly

Track reimbursements

Cross-Team Collaboration

Work closely with the Guest Services team to obtain context for charges, repairs, and supplies

Ask clarifying questions when needed to ensure accurate financial records

Maintain a collaborative, team-first mindset



Create Scorecard and Own Reporting on Data Points Below

Monthly

Net Operating Income %

Revenue Growth YoY and %

Payroll % of Income

Customer Acquisitions Costs

Life Time Value

EBITDA per Property

Gross Rents Per Property

Sales / Marketing Spend %

Software Spend %

Vendor 1099’s and W9 Collection

Own 1099 Process

Own 1099 Process and ensure all Vendors Contact information and W9 is up to date and accurate on a monthly basis in Quickbooks so that 1099 Season is a breeze. 

Reach out to vendors to collect information if not already given

Ad-Hoc reporting

Be able to work with business owner to run Ad-hoc reports 

Be forward thinking in using ChatGPT and other AI tools to analyze data quicker

Create custom GPT’s using ChatGPT based on data analyzed by ChatGPT



Occupancy Tax 

Pay out local jurisdictions in North Carolina occupancy tax. 





Required Skills & Qualifications

You MUST have a growth mindset and be willing to grow your skillset. 

Prior experience in bookkeeping, accounts payable, or accounting support

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Comfortable working with accounting software (QuickBooks or similar preferred)

Ability to manage recurring daily tasks and deadlines independently

Clear written communication and responsiveness during business hours

Strong organizational and time-management skills

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant or remote accounting support

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant or remote accounting support

Familiarity with property management, hospitality, or short-term rental businesses

Worked with VRPlatform

Worked with TopKey

Experience reviewing budgets, financial statements, or owner reports

What Success Looks Like

All invoices are processed and paid on time, every business day

Budget vs. actual variances are clearly tracked and communicated to business owner

Onboarding expenses are fully captured and easy to audit

Books remain clean with Zero uncategorized transactions on a weekly basis

Owner statements are accurate and require minimal corrections and completed by the 10th of each month

Strong communication and collaboration with the Guest Services team



Compensation

$850 USD per month w/ Annual performance bonus bonus

title: Cold Caller (Outbound Sales) - Telemarketing - Prospecting
description:
About Us



We manage luxury yachts and handle premium client requests daily.



We are looking for a disciplined, fast, and structured Outbound SDR (Cold Calling) to generate qualified interest through outbound calls and pass serious opportunities to our sales team.



This is a structured, process-driven role within a premium environment.



About the Role



You will be making outbound calls to targeted contacts and turning cold outreach into qualified yacht charter inquiries.



Your responsibility is to:



Make outbound calls with a calm, premium tone



Spark interest and identify whether there is real charter intent



Collect essential high-level information



Keep calls short, controlled, and professional



Write clean, structured notes and prepare a clear handoff summary



Maintain strict organization during your shift





This role requires clarity, control, and discipline, not aggressive selling.



What We Expect



Excellent spoken English (clear, professional, premium tone)



Confidence on the phone and ability to handle rejection calmly



Ability to keep conversations short and controlled



Structured thinking and strong attention to detail



Fast execution and consistency during shift



Comfort following a defined process



Very stable internet and professional working setup (quiet environment + headset; dual screen recommended)



Previous experience in cold calling.



Compensation



$500 per month (to start)



Long-term opportunity with growth potential



Working Style



We value:



Speed



Clean communication



Reliability



Maturity



Process discipline



It’s a structured, premium, and execution-focused role.



How to Apply



Please send:



A short introduction about yourself



Your previous outbound/calling experience



Your internet speed



Your availability (hours per day and days per week)



A 30–60 sec voice note in English (your natural phone tone)



We review applications carefully and only contact shortlisted candidates.

title: Operations Manager & HR Partner (The "Right Hand" to CEO)
description:
I am looking for a high-level Operations Manager / HR Partner in the Philippines to take full ownership of my business results. I am not looking for a Virtual Assistant who waits for instructions. I need a leader who brings solutions, manages the team, and ensures that every hire adds value to the company.



You will be the bridge between my vision and the team's execution. Your goal is to free up my time so I can focus on big-picture growth while you handle the day-to-day operations and team performance.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Team Leadership & HR: Recruit, onboard, and manage a team (including Sourcing and Communications managers). You will track their KPIs and ensure they are productive.



Operations & Supply Chain: Oversee the Alibaba sourcing process. Ensure quality control, negotiate better terms with suppliers, and manage procurement timelines.



Project Management: Drive the development of e-commerce projects, website content updates, and the creation of professional product catalogs.



Strategic Reporting: Provide weekly reports on business performance, team efficiency, and project status.



Required Qualifications:



Proven experience as an Operations Manager, Project Manager, or Team Lead.



Deep understanding of Alibaba sourcing and supply chain management.



Experience in E-commerce (website content management, catalog creation, digital sales flow).



Expert level in project management tools (Asana, ClickUp, or Trello).



Ability to make decisions independently and "manage up" (tell me what needs to be done, don't just ask).



Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal).



Why Work With Us?



Long-term, stable full-time position.



Performance-based bonuses (We reward results, not just hours).



Direct communication with the CEO.



Opportunity to help build and scale a business from the ground up.





HOW TO APPLY (Follow these instructions strictly):



Change the subject line of your application to: "I am the Leader you need for Aromika.



Briefly describe a situation where you managed a team and solved a major problem without the owner’s help.



Include a link to your Loom video (max 2 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining why you are an "A-Player" Manager, not just a VA.

s, newsletters, website) are consistent and professional.
