title: Strategic Alibaba Sourcing & Procurement Specialist
description:
We are looking for an experienced Sourcing & Procurement Specialist to handle our supply chain operations on Alibaba. Your main goal is to find the best manufacturers, negotiate the best possible terms, and ensure that every product that leaves China meets our high-quality standards.



You will report directly to our Operations Manager and work closely with the CEO.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Supplier Vetting: Identify and verify manufacturers on Alibaba (avoiding trading companies/middlemen).



Negotiation: Negotiate pricing, MOQs (Minimum Order Quantities), and payment terms (aiming for 30/70 splits via Trade Assurance).



Sample Management: Coordinate sample production and shipping to ensure they meet specifications.



Quality Control: Arrange third-party inspections and ensure all production issues are fixed before final payment.



Logistics Coordination: Work with freight forwarders to ensure timely delivery and correct documentation.



Required Qualifications:



Min 2-3 years of experience specifically in Alibaba sourcing for international markets.



Expertise in Trade Assurance, Incoterms (EXW, FOB, DDP), and factory audits.



Deep understanding of Quality Control (QC) processes.



Strong negotiation skills – you must be comfortable pushing back on suppliers to get better deals.



Highly organized with a "never trust, always verify" mindset.



Why Work With Us?



Stable, long-term full-time role.



Professional growth within a scaling e-commerce business.



Clear management structure (you will have a dedicated Operations Manager to support you).



HOW TO APPLY:



Change the subject line of your application to: "Master Sourcing Agent for Aromika".



List 3 specific "Red Flags" you look for when checking a new supplier's Alibaba profile.



Explain your process for handling a situation where a batch of 500 units has a 10?fect rate during inspection.



Include a link to your Loom video (max 2 minutes) explaining your biggest sourcing "win" (how you saved money or improved quality).

title: E-Com (Supplement) Video Editor
description:
What You’ll Do



• Turn scripts into high-converting ads

• Edit with performance in mind (hooks in 3 seconds, retention, pacing)

• Iterate quickly based on data

• Deliver fast turnaround (daily output required)



Speed matters. We move fast and test aggressively.



Who You Are



• You understand direct response marketing

• You’ve edited ads that actually scaled

• You can take a script and execute without hand-holding

• You’re comfortable working under tight deadlines

• You care about ROAS, not just aesthetics



If you need weeks to perfect one video, this role isn’t for you.



What We Expect



• Consistent output

• Same-day or next-day turnaround where required

• Clear communication

• Ownership of the editing process



To Apply



Do not send a generic resume.



Send:



A short intro video (max 2 minutes)



Your best performing direct response ads



A brief note explaining your fastest turnaround time on paid ads



Subject line: Direct Response Editor – Fast Execution



Strong candidates will receive a paid trial immediately.

title: Operations Manager - Retail & E-commerce
description:
We are supporting a fast-growing UK food startup in hiring a full-time Operations Manager.



This brand supplies major UK retailers and is expanding across Amazon and Shopify. The founders are currently managing operations themselves and are now ready to hand this over to someone experienced who can take responsibility and run with it.



This is a hands-on role inside a product-based business. It requires someone comfortable taking ownership, making decisions and improving systems without needing close supervision.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



1. Operations & Logistics (Core Focus)

- Coordinating stock between manufacturer, warehouse and retail partners

- Booking pallet deliveries and managing courier systems

- Working inside warehouse management systems such as Mintsoft

- Supporting Amazon inbound shipments

- Monitoring stock levels and preventing stock-outs

- Resolving delivery issues quickly and professionally, including occasional phone calls when required



2. Retail & Administrative Coordination

- Managing retailer portals and order systems

- Completing onboarding documentation

- Keeping operational records organised and accurate

- Supporting finance-related queries when needed



3. Customer Experience (Growing Area)

- Managing
 and chat enquiries

- Handling post-sale issues in a clear and professional manner



4. Process & Systems Ownership

- The founders are looking for someone who does more than follow instructions.

- You should be comfortable:

- Taking initiative

- Identifying inefficiencies

- Suggesting improvements

- Implementing better ways of working

- Managing recurring operational workflows independently



Over time, the expectation is that you become the go-to person for day-to-day operations.



Who This Role Suits



This role is best suited to someone who has already worked within a product-based or e-commerce business and understands how operations, logistics and retail coordination fit together.



You should:

- Have practical experience managing operational systems

- Be confident working across multiple platforms

- Be comfortable making judgement calls within agreed processes

- Communicate clearly and professionally



Startup experience is beneficial, as the environment is fast-moving and hands-on.



If interested, please apply through the following Zoho form link:

title: Copywriter
description:
About Us: GrumpyHare is a growing hosting company helping real estate investors succeed online with high performance websites. We recently launched our Done For You services, focused on simple, effective SEO strategies that attract motivated seller leads and drive organic growth. Our mission is to deliver clean, ethical SEO solutions that build long lasting results while protecting our clients' credibility and online reputation.



Role Overview: We’re looking for an experienced copywriter who thrives in a fast-paced, detail-oriented environment. In this role, you'll write and edit SEO optimized content that reflects our clients’ brand voice and supports their business goals with the Real Estate Investing world. You must have a strong understanding of content strategy, on-page SEO, excellent writing and grammar skills, and a passion for delivering polished, client-ready work.



Key Responsibilities:

- Write engaging, high-quality content for websites and blogs that are SEO focused within the real estate investing space

- Edit and proofread content for clarity, consistency, and alignment with brand guidelines

- Collaborate with your manager, the SEO team, web build team and the DFY manager to ensure all content meets strategic goals and SEO best practices

- Apply SEO principles, including keyword research, writing metadata, and internal linking

- Review content for grammar, tone, structure, and keyword use before final delivery

- Manage multiple client projects while staying on deadline

- Stay up to date with SEO trends and Google algorithm updates



Qualifications

- 5 or more years of professional copywriting experience, ideally in real estate, digital marketing, or SEO

- Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills

- Strong understanding of SEO best practices and on-page optimization

- Excellent communication skills with the ability to adapt tone and style

- Comfortable using Google Docs, WordPress, and basic HTML

- Experience with project management platforms like 
, Asana, or Trello

- Self motivated, organized, and comfortable working remotely



Why Join Us?

- Join a team passionate about ethical, simple SEO practices.

- Use your skills to make a visible impact with minimal complexity.

- Thrive in a supportive, collaborative environment.



How to Apply:

Send the following to Ria at 
 CC 

- Your updated resume

- A portfolio showcasing your sample write-ups

Please include "Copywriter” in the subject line.



NOTE: Applications missing any of the above requirements will not be reviewed.



Thank you and we can’t wait to hear from you!

title: Operations Manager & HR Partner (The "Right Hand" to CEO) – High Responsibility
description:
I am looking for a high-level Operations Manager / HR Partner in the Philippines to take full ownership of my business results. I am not looking for a Virtual Assistant who waits for instructions. I need a leader who brings solutions, manages the team, and ensures that every hire adds value to the company.



You will be the bridge between my vision and the team's execution. Your goal is to free up my time so I can focus on big-picture growth while you handle the day-to-day operations and team performance.



Your Core Responsibilities:



Team Leadership & HR: Recruit, onboard, and manage a team (including Sourcing and Communications managers). You will track their KPIs and ensure they are productive.



Operations & Supply Chain: Oversee the Alibaba sourcing process. Ensure quality control, negotiate better terms with suppliers, and manage procurement timelines.



Project Management: Drive the development of e-commerce projects, website content updates, and the creation of professional product catalogs.



Strategic Reporting: Provide weekly reports on business performance, team efficiency, and project status.



Required Qualifications:



Proven experience as an Operations Manager, Project Manager, or Team Lead.



Deep understanding of Alibaba sourcing and supply chain management.



Experience in E-commerce (website content management, catalog creation, digital sales flow).



Expert level in project management tools (Asana, ClickUp, or Trello).



Ability to make decisions independently and "manage up" (tell me what needs to be done, don't just ask).



Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal).



Why Work With Us?



Long-term, stable full-time position.



Performance-based bonuses (We reward results, not just hours).



Direct communication with the CEO.



Opportunity to help build and scale a business from the ground up.





HOW TO APPLY (Follow these instructions strictly):



Change the subject line of your application to: "I am the Leader you need for Aromika.



Briefly describe a situation where you managed a team and solved a major problem without the owner’s help.



Include a link to your Loom video (max 2 minutes) introducing yourself and explaining why you are an "A-Player" Manager, not just a VA.

title: Digital Marketing Operations Specialist (SEO, PPC, Meta Ads) – AI-Driven Role
description:
Job Type



Full-time (40 hrs/week)

Remote – Philippines Only



Compensation



Up to $15/hour (based on experience and performance)



?



About Us



We are a fast-growing digital marketing company focused on performance-driven lead generation across multiple channels. We already have proven strategies and systems in place — what we need now is strong execution.



We leverage AI and custom GPT tools to scale faster, work smarter, and reduce inefficiencies. This role is perfect for someone who understands digital marketing fundamentals and enjoys working with structured systems, reporting, and optimization.



?



Role Overview



We are not looking for a traditional Marketing Manager.



Instead, we are hiring a highly capable Digital Marketing Operations Specialist who can:

 • Execute and optimize campaigns

 • Manage reporting and scorecards

 • Feed accurate data into our custom GPT systems

 • Support creative testing and performance analysis



You will work closely with leadership and AI tools to manage and optimize multiple lead sources.



?



Key Responsibilities



Digital Marketing Execution

 • Assist with SEO, PPC (Google Ads), Meta Ads, and Retargeting

 • Monitor campaign performance and flag optimization opportunities

 • Support creative testing (ads, copy, landing page variations)

 • Help coordinate ad creatives with internal or freelance designers



Reporting & Optimization

 • Build and maintain marketing scorecards and performance dashboards

 • Track KPIs such as CPL, ROAS, CTR, conversion rates, and lead quality

 • Prepare weekly and monthly performance summaries

 • Identify trends, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement



AI & Systems Support

 • Feed campaign data, insights, and performance notes into custom GPT tools

 • Follow structured SOPs for AI-assisted optimization workflows

 • Help refine prompts, inputs, and outputs for better AI decision-making



Operational Support

 • Maintain clean documentation and reporting processes

 • Ensure data accuracy across platforms

 • Execute tasks efficiently with minimal supervision once trained



?



Required Skills & Experience



Must-Have:

 • Solid understanding of SEO, Google Ads (PPC), Meta Ads, and Retargeting

 • Experience with digital marketing reporting and optimization

 • Strong attention to detail and data accuracy

 • Comfortable working with systems, SOPs, and structured workflows

 • Reliable internet and strong English comprehension



Nice-to-Have (Big Plus):

 • Experience working with AI tools (ChatGPT, automation, dashboards)

 • Experience with marketing scorecards or dashboards

 • Agency or lead-generation background

 • Familiarity with CRMs, tracking pixels, or analytics tools



?



Who This Role Is Perfect For

 • You enjoy execution more than strategy meetings

 • You are organized, analytical, and process-driven

 • You like working with AI tools instead of manual busywork

 • You want long-term, stable work with growth opportunities

 • You can follow systems but also think critically when reviewing data



?



What We Provide

 • Clear SOPs and training

 • Access to custom GPT and AI systems

 • Long-term role with growth potential

 • Performance-based raises and responsibility increases

 • A company that values efficiency, clarity, and results



?



How to Apply



Please include:

 1. A brief summary of your experience with SEO, PPC, and Meta Ads

 2. Any experience with reporting, dashboards, or optimization

 3. Confirmation that you can work full-time 8am-5pm EST

        4.     Your OnlineJobsPH profile link and Are you comfortable using Worksnaps time tracker during your working hours? This tool monitors completed tasks and overall productivity throughout the shift.



Applicants that did not follow the above instructions will not be considered.

title: US Tax Accountant
description:
Company Description

Jeff Pickering, CPA is a fast-growing midsize accounting firm based in Plano, Texas. We provide comprehensive accounting and advisory services backed by deep industry experience and a strong commitment to personal service.



Position: US Tax Accountant

We are seeking an eperienced Tax Accountant to collaborate with our team on U.S. tax return preparation, compliance, and advisory services for a diverse client base



Scope of Work

- Prepare and review U.S. tax returns for individuals and various business entities

- Interpret tax documents and prepare supporting workpapers based on client submissions

- Research tax issues and apply appropriate IRS and state guidance to support tax positions

- Address tax notices from the IRS or state agencies, and communicate directly with clients as needed

- Assist with general accounting services, bookkeeping, payroll, and sales tax filings when required

- Utilize UltraTax CS (required) and other accounting tools such as QuickBooks Online/Desktop

- Collaborate with tea
mbers and contribute to process improvements

- Maintain professionalism, confidentiality, and adherence to U.S. tax standards



Qualifications

- Strong foundational knowledge of U.S. tax law and tax forms

- Proficient in UltraTax (required) and comfortable with related tax software

- Experience with interpreting Forms W-2, 1099, 1098, K-1, and related tax documents

- Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills

- Reliable, organized, and able to manage time effectively with minimal supervision

- Clear communicator, both written and verbal, with professional client interaction skills

- Open to feedback and committed to continuous learning



Minimum Education Qualifications

- Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting

- Active PH Certified Public Accountant (CPA) license



Other Requirements

- Minimum 2 years of US tax preparation experience

- Experience working with clients directly and handling tax-related inquiries or notices

- Availability for extended hours during U.S. tax season



Working Hours

- For the first 6 months: required to work 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM CST

- After 6 months: required hours adjust to 9:00 AM to 11:00 AM CST, with flexibility, but must attend any scheduled client or tea
etings

- Weekly workload: minimum of 40 hours per week



Compensation

- PhP 700/hour | PhP 110,000/month (based on 40 hours/week)

- This reflects the base rate. Paid overtime is available for hours beyond 40 per week.

- There are also opportunities for bonuses and additional earnings based on productivity and performance.

- Total annual compensation ranges from PhP1.5M to PhP2.5M.

- Engagement duration: Initial 6-month term, renewable based on performance and project needs



How to Apply

Submit your resume to 



Contact Information

If you have any questions or need further information, please contact us at

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
About Naturally Fantastic



Naturally Fantastic is a boutique retreat design studio helping remote-first tech companies gather with intention.



I’m Natalia, the founder - and until now, I’ve led everything from venue sourcing and negotiation to client strategy and growth.



Now it’s time to build a more structured, strategic approach to lead generation, content, and partnerships.



I’m looking for someone who wants to help shape that next chapter.



This role is for you if…



- You’ve driven B2B lead generation in service-based, founder-led, or experience-driven businesses

- You’re comfortable with outbound - LinkedIn conversations,
 sequences, and strategic follow-ups

- You can write clear, persuasive content and translate ideas into landing pages that convert

- You take ownership

- You care about results and outcomes more than staying busy

- You feel at home in remote-first, async environments



This role is NOT for you if…



- You need layers of process or constant direction

- You prefer “business as usual” over building and improving

- You wait for permission instead of taking initiative



Responsibilities



1. Lead Generation



- Build targeted lists of Heads of People at remote-first tech companies

- Initiate personalized LinkedIn and
 outreach

- Optimize the website and LinkedIn profile for conversion

- Test and refine growth channels: LinkedIn outreach, value-led
 sequences, and strategic partnerships within the remote-first ecosystem



2. Content & Storytelling



- Own the monthly marketing rhythm (content planning for LinkedIn and Instagram, task tracking, execution)

- Transform past retreats into compelling case studies that build trust and support sales

- Create lead magnets that qualify buyers (planning guides, budget frameworks, retreat roadmaps)

- Build and manage
 nurture sequences that move leads toward conversations



3. Strategic Partnerships



- Identify and engage the communities where People & Culture leaders gather - HR circles, remote-first platforms, curated newsletters, and industry events

- Build thoughtful, long-term relationships that lead to aligned collaborations and referrals

title: Business Development Manager
description:
We're looking for a highly organized and relationship-focused Business Development Manager to help manage and grow a large network of professional contacts in the entertainment industry (music, sports, film/TV, digital). This role is about meaningful outreach, follow-up, and building long-term trust across a large portfolio.



If you're detail-oriented, a strong communicator, and excited by the world of entertainment, this role could be a great fit. Must have good English writing abilities without use of AI. 



What You’ll Be Doing:



- Manage a High Volume of Contacts: Oversee a large list of professional accounts, ensuring regular communication and accurate recordkeeping.

- Outreach & Relationship Building: Proactively reach out to contacts via
 and social media to stay connected, share updates, and strengthen professional relationships.

- Craft Well-Written Messages: Write polished, thoughtful
s and messages in English—clear, natural communication is key.

- Track Progress: Use tools like HubSpot to manage follow-ups, keep conversations organized, and hit relationship-building goals.

- Work Toward Clear Targets: While there’s no selling involved, this role does have measurable outreach and engagement goals.

- Think Creatively: Develop new approaches for keeping relationships active, warm, and productive over time.



Who We’re Looking For:

- Excellent written English—you’re comfortable writing professional messages and outreach
s with clarity and polish. - - -- Must have strong English writing and speaking abilities.

- Extremely organized—you can juggle many accounts and keep your outreach and follow-ups on track.

- Self-motivated and driven—you take initiative, meet goals, and stay focused without constant supervision.

- Relationship-minded—you enjoy connecting with people and maintaining positive, long-term communication.

- Familiarity with CRM tools like HubSpot is a plus.

- Spanish fluency is a plus, but not required.

- A genuine interest in the entertainment industry—especially music, sports, film/TV, or digital media—will help you succeed in this role.





Apply here:

title: Virtual Assistants needed for AirBnB VA Agency
description:
Hello!



Thanks for stopping by to read this ad.



We are a growing VA agency called FREEDOM VAs (FVA), who specialise in providing VA services for a range of AirBnB businesses



The core team consists of six Filipino VAs, 2 of whom have been working with me for over seven years, four of whom have been working with me around two years, and myself, having been in the Airbnb game since 2015 and working with Filipino VAs since 2017.



We operate a little differently to other agencies, in that we have 'walked the walk' and I regularly coach our clients on how to operate their business optimally, create the ideal working conditions for you, as well as coaching and mentoring you to make sure you're flourishing.



We're looking for people with three different working styles, which can be used interchangeably depending on the shift:

A. 'Front of house' style Receptionist (everyone will need at least a good grasp on this)

B. Back-end organiser of the Housekeeping and Maintenance teams

C. Listing administration, success tracking, recruitment and leadership



You may be one, or a combination of these three and to varying degrees. Please do mention what that blend is for you in your cover note. If you specialise in one particular area, we prefer that more, because you will get by with some basic training from us in the other areas.



Your main roles will include:



- 'Front of house / front desk' call answering

- Responding to messages on all platforms

- Closing sales enquiries

- Prompting for good reviews

- Understanding the guest by building a relationship with them

- Giving the guest the best experience possible by resolving their issues promptly and making helpful suggestions before being asked for them

- Understanding when bad reviews are likely and not prompting the guest to leave one

- Linking in other teaUpgrade to see actual infombers to deliver the best guest experience

- Be responsible for the perception of the business to the outside world. This will mean ensuring good reviews, and having complete listings

- Feeding back guest comments from conversations

- Housekeeping, maintenance and compliance operations

- Creating audits and reporting back to management

- Review management

- Creating new listings from scratch

- Working within a much larger team

- Recruiting new VAs as the team evolves



In addition to your core roles, you will be expected to have the following qualities:



- Excellent written and spoken English

- Thoroughness and attention to detail

- Self-starter and can-do attitude

- Making sure all of our teams are communicating effectively in the context of your work

- Being proactive about your own progress and productivity

- Working within a culture which values passion, teamwork, personal accountability and integrity

- Willingness to succeed through further learning

- Working in an organised way with clear emphasis on deadlines and the need to track and quantify performance



Experience of having worked on platforms like AirBnB and Booking dot com are necessary, and experience in the hotel and hospitality sector will be looked at favourably.



Your written English should be exceptional, your communication style should be concise, friendly and logical. You should also be able to handle arithmetic on the spot, and have a sound understanding of prioritisation and urgency.



Please remember that part of your role will be to understand what our current admins do and there may be some elements of undertaking their responsibilities for periods of time. This will provide the foundation upon which your role will be built, and as you become more familiar with our end clients, you will naturally start to do more focused work.



We’re looking for someone who’s responsive, committed, reliable, trustworthy and places a high value on confidentiality and security. You must have the ability to remain confident, calm and quick under pressure and use initiative and common sense to achieve the goals of the business. A strong emphasis on systemisation, communication and written English will form a key part of your skill base.



We're an ambitious company, committed to high standards, and we're looking for similarly driven, motivated individuals to work with us and delight our clients!



Right now though, we are advertising for Virtual Assistants who are flexible and available to work on weekends, public holidays, and afternoon or graveyard shifts (UK time), 30-40 hrs / week.





If you've read up until this point, then well done! When applying for the role, please enter "FreedomVA2026!" as your subject line and leave the following details in your main message:

- Your preferred style of working (A, B, C) from above, and if it's all 3 then a brief explanation on the split.



Once you've done this, I will send you a link to a form to submit. After I've reviewed the forms, I'll send out links for interviews.



Best of luck, and hope to meet with you soon!



Satya

title: Senior WordPress Web Developer
description: We’re seeking an experienced WordPress Web Developer with 10+ years of hands-on experience building high-quality websites. You’ll be responsible for translating Figma designs into clean, responsive WordPress builds, with strong knowledge of Tailwind CSS and ACF Flexible Content. Experience using GitHub for version control is essential. Attention to detail, clear communication, and a strong work ethic are key to succeeding in this role.

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Social Media Management & Distribution

Platform Execution: Manage daily posting and engagement on Instagram,
, TikTok, and Pinterest.



Reddit Strategy: Actively monitor and participate in parenting subreddits (e.g., r/beyondthebump, r/NewParents). Your job is to provide value and subtly mention our products when they solve a parent's problem (e.g., recommending the Toddly Bed Rail).



Community Management: Respond to all comments and messages with a warm, helpful brand voice within 60 minutes during your shift.



2. Influencer & Brand Outreach

Sourcing: Identify 25+ new micro-influencers (parents/nursery stylists) in Australia every week who align with our "Brand House" aesthetic.



Vetting: Ensure influencers have authentic engagement and a clean reputation.



Campaign Management: Send outreach templates, manage the negotiation process under Erjyne's guidance, and track the shipping of "gifted" products to influencers.



3. Content Support

Repurposing: Take high-quality "faceless" content or AI-generated videos and adapt them for different platforms (e.g., turning a TikTok into a Pinterest Idea Pin).



Graphic Design: Assist Erjyne in Canva with simple edits, updating banners, or creating "Review" tiles for social media.



4. Administrative & Growth Support

Reporting: Track the success of influencer posts (likes, comments, and mentions) and provide a simple weekly summary.



Cross-Functional Support: When the marketing queue is clear, provide backup support to the E-commerce Manager for customer service tasks (handling "Where is my order?" tickets) and product listings.

title: Automation & AI Systems Specialist
description:
Team Hummus helps business owners scale through YouTube using our premium coaching program, Content Growth Engine (CGE).

As we grow, our backend systems must remain clean, stable, and scalable — especially across client support, AI automation, and internal workflows.

Growth without infrastructure leads to confusion.

This role prevents that.

The Problem This Role Solves

As our client base grows:

Automations become fragile

AI responses become inconsistent

Ticket systems create noise

Workflows overlap

Team confusion increases





Without strong automation ownership, scaling breaks systems.

This role ensures our backend is stable, intelligent, and predictable — so clients receive consistent support and the team operates efficiently.



Goal of This Role

Maintain stable automation infrastructure

Ensure AI responses are accurate and on-brand

Reduce ticket noise and operational confusion

Create predictable system behavior

Future-proof our AI and automation stack

Your work directly impacts client experience, operational clarity, and scalability.



Role Overview

We’re hiring an Automation & AI Systems Specialist to own and optimize our:

Intercom automations

Zapier workflows

Active Campaign triggers

AI configurations across all support platforms and CRMs (Intercom, CRM etc)

Ticket logic and assignment systems

This role is investigative, technical, and systems-focused.



Core Responsibilities

Automation Infrastructure



Audit and stabilize Intercom, Zapier, and Active Campaign workflows

Review calendar-triggered automations

Audit trigger logic and conditions

Prevent fragile or overlapping workflows

Clarify automation ownership internally



AI Configuration & Testing

Configure Copilot tone and logic

Align AI responses with brand voice

Compare Copilot vs. Fin AI outputs

Test and refine AI response quality

Escalate limitations to Intercom engineers





Ticket Structure & Noise Control

Investigate unnecessary ticket creation

Analyze assignment logic

Research round-robin feasibility

Evaluate external integration impact

Reduce system noise and confusion





Technical Investigation

Backread issues and trace root causes

Validate system triggers

Research integration options (Zapier, ClickUp handover, etc.)

Document findings clearly in structured EOD reports





Strategic AI Exploration

Research voice AI opportunities

Explore automation use cases for marketing

Align AI capabilities with business growth





Tools You’ll Work With

Core Systems & Automation

Intercom (Workflows, Copilot, Fin AI, Inbox, Help Center)

Zapier (multi-step zaps, filters, webhooks)

Active Campaign (automations, tagging, triggers)

ClickUp (task automation, handover flows)

Slack (integrations + alert monitoring)





AI & Configuration

Intercom Copilot

Fin AI

ChatGPT / Claude (testing, prompt refinement, tone comparison)

Knowledge base management systems

Integrations & Infrastructure

Webhooks

API-based integrations

Calendar-triggered workflows (Calendly or similar tools)

CRM and funnel tools (as applicable)

Form-based triggers and routing logic

Monitoring & Documentation

Internal SOP documentation tools

Automation audit sheets

System mapping tools (Miro or similar)



? You’re a Great Fit If You:

Have hands-on Intercom + Zapier experience

Understand automation logic deeply

Have configured AI/chatbot systems

Think in systems and flows

Enjoy diagnosing technical inconsistencies

Document clearly and communicate technical insights simply





What Success Looks Like

Automations are stable and predictable

AI responses match brand voice

Ticket noise is significantly reduced

Internal confusion decreases

Systems scale without breaking

title: Full-Time Community Manager (Facebook/Instagram Ad Comments + Trustpilot)
description:
APPLY HERE:







Stepprs is hiring a full-time Community Manager to be the voice of our brand on
 and Instagram ad comments and on Trustpilot. This role is for someone with excellent written English, high emotional intelligence, and a natural ability to reply with personality while staying professional. Your goal is to turn ad comments into conversations, increase engagement, and help create viral comment threads while also protecting the brand and guiding people to the right next step. You will respond to questions, objections, jokes, and negative comments calmly and confidently. You will also write thoughtful Trustpilot responses that improve our public reputation.



This is not a basic customer support role. We need someone who can think fast, write well, ask smart follow-up questions, and understand how to keep a comment section active without sounding scripted or salesy. You must be comfortable working with high volume and staying consistent every day.



Responsibilities:

- Reply to
 and Instagram ad comments quickly and with strong English, staying on-brand at all times

- Ask engaging follow-up questions that encourage more replies and create comment threads

- Handle objections and skepticism in a calm, confident way without arguing or sounding defensive

- Respond to negative comments and trolls professionally, without escalating situations

- Identify high-impact comments to prioritize when volume is high (questions, objections, viral opportunities)

- Reply to Trustpilot reviews in a genuine, helpful tone and escalate issues to the internal team when needed

- Follow brand voice guidelines and continuously improve replies based on what performs best

- Track recurring questions and feedback from comments and report patterns to the team



Requirements:

- Excellent written English (near-native or native-level)

- Strong personality and communication skills; your replies should feel human, not robotic

- High emotional intelligence and good judgment in public conversations

- Ability to stay calm under pressure and handle negativity professionally

- Fast typing speed and ability to manage high comment volume without losing quality

- Reliable internet and consistent availability for full-time work

- Experience with social media comments, community management, or customer-facing roles is preferred (but not required if you are a strong fit)



What Success Looks Like:

- Higher comment engagement on ads (more replies and longer threads)

- Fast response times with consistently high-quality replies

- Positive, professional handling of negative comments and objections

- Trustpilot responses that feel genuine and reduce public concerns





APPLY HERE:

title: Director of Sales & Leadership Development
description:
Role Overview

The Director of Sales & Leadership Development is responsible for driving revenue

performance across three primary areas:



1) Call Center Sales Performance & Leadership Development

2) Growth Representative Performance (Realtor Acquisition & Retention)

3) Sales and Marketing Revenue Alignment

This role owns close ratio, ticket average, leader development, field growth effectiveness,

and the revenue feedback loop between sales and marketing.

Primary Responsibilities



1) Call Center Sales Leadership & Performance

The Director will:

• Improve close ratio and overall conversion performance

• Increase average ticket size through package optimization and structured upsell systems

• Develop and train Team Leads and future Managers

• Implement objection-handling frameworks and call review standards

• Lead structured call audits and coaching cadence

• Build and maintain a Sales Playbook and leader certification program

• Hold sales leaders accountable for coaching activity and measurable improvement

Key Outcomes:

• Higher close ratio

• Higher ticket average

• Strong frontline leaders capable of coaching independently



2) Growth Representative Leadership (Realtor Acquisition & Retention)

The Director will:

• Improve realtor retention through structured follow-up systems

• Strengthen onboarding processes for new realtors

• Improve cold calling and expansion strategy in new markets

• Establish clear activity standards for boots-on-the-ground Growth Reps

• Track and improve referral conversion by market



• Build accountability systems to measure farming vs hunting effectiveness

Key Outcomes:

• Increased realtor retention rate

• Increased new realtor acquisition

• Improved referral consistency and productivity per market



3) Sales ? Marketing Revenue Alignment (Every 30 Days)

The Director is responsible for ensuring that marketing performance is aligned to revenue

outcomes.

Every 30 days, the Director will lead a structured Sales ? Marketing Revenue Alignment

meeting to review performance data and implement revenue-driven adjustments.

The 30-Day Revenue Review must include:

• Close rate by lead source (last 30 days)

• Qualified lead rate by source

• Top 5 objections heard from paid ad leads

• Ticket average by source

• Market or campaign performance improvements and root cause analysis

• One revenue-focused test to implement in the next 30 days (offer, message, targeting, or

positioning adjustment)

This role is responsible for providing actionable sales data to the marketing team. The

marketing team is responsible for execution.



Key Outcomes:

• Improved close ratio from paid ad leads

• Improved revenue per lead

• Reduced lead waste

• Clear marketing ROI accountability

Role Boundaries

The Director provides revenue insight, performance analysis, and strategic direction.

This role does not:

• Manage ad creative production

• Run PPC campaigns directly

• Execute media buying

• Perform graphic design or content posting

The Director ensures marketing is revenue-aligned. Execution remains with the marketing

team.



KPIs & Performance Metrics

1) Call Center Performance KPIs (Primary Revenue Engine)

A. Ticket Average

• Current Baseline: $640

• Target Goal: $820

B. Close Ratio

• Target Goal: 80%

C. Ultra Package Penetration

• Target Goal: 50% or greater Ultra package penetration

• Standard: High-performing agents should exceed 50% Ultra package adoption rate



2) Growth Representative KPI

Agent Retention Rate

• Target Goal: 3% retention rate improvement (minimum benchmark; further growth

expected as systems stabilize)



3) Marketing KPI

Percentage of Qualified Leads

• Target Goal: 70% qualified lead rate



KPI Priority Order

1) Ticket Average ($640 ? $820)

2) Close Ratio (80%)

3) Ultra Package Penetration (?50%)

4) Agent Retention (3%+ improvement)

5) Qualified Leads (70%)
salary: Base Salary: 16 usd to 21 usd per hour

title: Video Editor Needed — Long-Form Course Content (Not Social Media Editing)
description:
I’m looking for a video editor who specializes in **long-form educational content**, specifically for online course modules not social media reels. This role is for someone who understands how to create a **calm, conversational learning experience**, not viral-style content.



---



???? Please DO NOT apply if your editing style includes:

• Big karaoke captions with highlighted words

• Cartoon graphics, emojis, or pop-ups

• Loud sound effects or “whoosh” transitions

• Fast TikTok-style jump cuts

• UGC/commercial ad editing

• Influencer or YouTube reaction editing



That is not the style I’m looking for.



---

What I AM looking for:

An editor who can create:



• Online course modules

• Coaching / educational lessons

• Clean talking-head edits

• Calm, minimal, professional pacing

• Simple, elegant storytelling



The overall feeling should be:



• Conversational and natural

• Cozy mentor energy

• Clear and easy to follow

• Focused on learning, not entertainment



Think:

“Sit with me while I teach you.”



---

Experience Required

You should have experience with at least one of the following:



• Editing long-form educational videos

• Online course or e-learning content

• Coaching or masterclass videos

• Documentary-style or brand storytelling



---



What You’ll Be Editing

• Hairstylist coaching course modules

• Talking-head lessons

• Demonstrations and screen recordings



Typical video length: **5–30 minutes**



---



Skills Needed

You should be comfortable with:



• Clean pacing and natural cuts

• Color correction and audio cleanup

• Subtle transitions

• Minimal, tasteful text use

• Organized file delivery



---



How to Apply

Please send:



1. **Long-form editing samples only** (5+ minutes)

2. Examples of educational or coaching content (if available)

3. Your rate for editing a 10–30 minute video

4. Typical turnaround time



Applications with only short-form or social media work will not be considered.



---



Test Project

Qualified candidates will receive a short sample clip for a **paid test edit**.



---



I’m looking for a long-term editor who understands how to create a **clean, calm learning environment** not trend-based editing. If that sounds like you, I’d love to see your work.

title: Disposition Manager – Real Estate Wholesaling (Base + Commission)
description:
We are looking for a disposition manager to help move wholesale real estate deals nationwide.



This is not an entry-level or general VA role. You must already understand real estate wholesaling and have experience selling deals to buyers. The role is remote and performance-driven, with consistent deal flow. REAL WHOLESALE EXPERIENCE ONLY.



You’ll be responsible for marketing contracted properties to buyers, managing buyer relationships, sending deal blasts, posting in buyer groups, following up with interested buyers, negotiating assignments, and coordinating with title companies through closing. You should be comfortable speaking with buyers on the phone and understand assignment contracts, EMDs, and closing timelines.



Compensation is $1,000 per month base plus 5% commission on every deal that closes. Commission is paid per closing. This is a long-term role with the opportunity to increase volume and earnings as performance proves out.



This role is a good fit for someone who has already dispo’d wholesale deals, knows how to move properties efficiently, and wants steady deal volume without having to find their own contracts.



To apply, please briefly explain your experience with wholesaling and dispositions, how many deals you’ve personally dispo’d, and how you typically sell deals to buyers. Include your timezone and availability.



If you can move deals, this will be a strong opportunity.

title: Travel Consultant - Business Development Specialist (For our Travel Company)
description:
This role is for our Travel company



We are seeking a highly driven and creative Business Developer – Travel Industry to join our growing team. This role focuses on generating new business opportunities, designing compelling travel packages, and expanding our client base across local and international markets. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in travel package creation, supplier coordination, and lead generation within the tourism and hospitality space.



This role requires a strategic mindset, excellent communication skills, and an in-depth understanding of travel trends, pricing strategies, and customer preferences.



Key Responsibilities

Business Development & Sales Growth



Identify and secure new business opportunities in both B2C and B2B travel markets

Develop sales strategies to increase bookings, conversions, and long-term partnerships

Conduct market research to identify emerging travel trends, competitor offerings, and customer demands

Generate leads through outreach, networking, digital channels, and strategic partnerships



Travel Package Design & Management



Create tailored travel packages including itineraries, tours, accommodations, and transportation

Negotiate with airlines, hotels, tour operators, and local suppliers for competitive pricing

Build themed packages (e.g., family vacations, adventure trips, corporate retreats, honeymoon tours)

Ensure all packages are accurate, cost-efficient, and aligned with market demand



Client Relationship & Coordination



Manage and nurture relationships with travel agencies, corporate accounts, and direct clients

Conduct consultations to understand client needs and recommend suitable package options

Communicate travel details clearly and ensure seamless customer experience from inquiry to post-travel follow-up

Handle inquiries, revisions, and special requirements promptly and professionally



Operations & Process Management



Coordinate with internal teams to ensure accurate package documentation and timely delivery

Oversee booking processes, confirmations, and supplier coordination

Monitor package performance, pricing updates, and seasonal adjustments

Identify opportunities for upsells, add-ons, and premium package enhancements



Marketing & Promotional Support



Collaborate with marketing teams to promote travel packages across social media,
 campaigns, and partner networks

Provide insights for content, promotions, and seasonal travel offers

Track and report campaign performance related to travel package sales



Required Skills & Experience

Educational Requirements



Bachelor’s degree in Business, Tourism Management, Hospitality, Marketing, or a related field



Essential Experience



Minimum 3+ years experience in the travel, tourism, or hospitality industry

Proven track record in business development, sales, or travel package creation

Strong understanding of domestic and international travel destinations, pricing structures, and industry trends

Experience working with travel suppliers, GDS systems, booking platforms, or travel CRM tools



Technical & Professional Skills



Expertise in designing travel packages, itineraries, and costings

Excellent negotiation and relationship-building skills with travel suppliers

Strong communication and presentation skills

Ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously

Proficiency in digital communication tools and basic travel-industry software



Application Instruction:

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Part-Time Outbound & Cold Call Specialist
description:
We’re hiring a part-time Outreach & Market Research Associate to help us better understand how engineering and infrastructure firms manage grant-funded projects.



This role blends research, business development, and real conversations with industry professionals.



What You’ll Be Doing:

- Researching civil engineering and infrastructure firms across the U.S.

- Identifying decision-makers involved in project oversight and grant-funded work

- Conducting outbound calls to learn about their current workflows

- Exploring how firms track documentation, reporting, and compliance for local/state grants

- Scheduling follow-up conversations when there’s alignment



We will provide:

- A targeted prospect list

- Defined personas and outreach direction

- Positioning guidance and call structure

- Ongoing coaching and refinement



The Opportunity:



Many firms managing public infrastructure and state-funded projects are still relying on manual systems (often Excel-based) to handle documentation and reporting. As project volume grows, this can create workflow bottlenecks and compliance exposure.



Your role is to gather insight, spark conversations, and identify firms open to improving how they manage grant-funded projects.



If you read this far please include "cold" at the top of your application along with a cold call recording as well in your application.

title: Content Creator
description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a dynamic and creative Content Creator to join our team. This individual will engage with people on the streets of Manila, Cebu, or other cities, conducting casual interviews to produce captivating social content. The ideal candidate is comfortable on camera, has strong communication skills, and enjoys approaching strangers to ask thought-provoking questions. The content generated will focus on community engagement and real-life perspectives, with a minimal emphasis on direct company branding.



Key Responsibilities:

-Conduct street interviews in various cities, asking insightful questions about daily lives, work routines, and opinions on virtual assistants.

-Produce high-quality, engaging video content that feels authentic and connects with a broad audience.

-Edit videos to create short, impactful content for social media platforms.

-Interact with the community to showcase real-life experiences, viewpoints, and emerging trends.

-Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure content aligns with ongoing campaigns and resonates with the target audience.

-Maintain a professional yet approachable tone in all content produced.



Mandatory Skills:

-Excellent verbal communication and interviewing abilities.

-Comfort speaking with strangers and filming interviews in public settings.

-Experience with video shooting and basic editing (creating quick, engaging content).

-Familiarity with social media platforms and trends in content creation.

-Creative mindset to come up with compelling questions and content ideas.

-Ability to work independently and manage time effectively while traveling across locations.



Preferred Skills:

-Experience in street interviews or content creation.

-Basic video editing skills (familiarity with tools like iMovie, Adobe Premiere, etc.).

-Previous experience producing engaging social media content.

-Comfort using social media for content distribution and community engagement.

-Ability to adapt content for various platforms (Instagram, TikTok,
, etc.).



Why Join Us:

This is a flexible, dynamic role that offers the chance to create engaging content in an authentic, non-branded environment. You'll have the freedom to explore different cities, interact with diverse individuals, and contribute to the creation of impactful social media content. If you're passionate about storytelling and creating relatable, fun, and thought-provoking videos, this opportunity is perfect for you!

title: High-Speed WordPress & WooCommerce Specialist (Full-Time / Long-Term)
description:
Overview

We are looking for a highly efficient, dedicated WordPress & WooCommerce Developer to lead the build, maintenance, and expansion of our e-commerce sites. We are moving away from other platforms to focus 100% on WooCommerce.



Crucial Requirement: We need rapid execution. You must be able to build and launch new, fully functional websites from the ground up within a 1-2 day maximum turnaround time. You will be responsible for spinning up new stores at lightning speed, managing 
, and ensuring our entire portfolio stays fast, secure, and optimized for conversions. This is a full-time role for someone who wants to grow with a fast-moving team.



Key Responsibilities



Rapid New Builds: Develop and launch high-converting WooCommerce stores from scratch (custom themes or high-performance builders) with a strict 1-2 day maximum turnaround.



Ongoing Maintenance: Responsible for the health of 
 and future sites, including security patches, plugin management, and daily backups.



Performance Scaling: Ensure sites are optimized for high traffic, specifically focusing on mobile speed and checkout stability.



Custom Tweaks: Execute daily requests for layout changes, custom product pages, and technical troubleshooting with fast response times.



Database Management: Keep the backend clean and organized as we scale our product catalogs.



Technical Requirements



WooCommerce Mastery: Expert knowledge of the WooCommerce core, including checkout customization and shipping/tax configurations.



WordPress Development: Proficient in PHP, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.



Hosting & Server Knowledge: Experience managing sites on high-performance hosting (e.g., SiteGround, WP Engine, or VPS).



Plugin Expertise: Ability to vet and implement the best plugins for SEO, speed (WP Rocket), and security without bloating the site.



Conversion Focus: Experience setting up tracking pixels (Meta, Google) and optimizing for ROAS.



The Ideal Candidate



You are incredibly fast: A 1-2 day turnaround for a complete website build doesn't scare you—it is your standard operating speed.



You are a WooCommerce specialist, not a Shopify dev who "also does" WordPress.



You are proactive—you fix bugs before we even notice them.



You are available for full-time collaboration and quick adjustments.



How to Apply

Please provide:



A link to 2-3 WooCommerce stores you have built or currently maintain.



Your experience with scaling WordPress sites for high-volume sales.



A brief explanation of your workflow and how you manage to build and launch a complete store in 1 to 2 days.

title: US Certified CPA
description:
We are looking for a meticulous and proactive USA Certified Public Accountant (CPA) based in the Philippines to take full ownership of the financial health of our portfolio companies, and work for Do Good Group (
). Our focus is to create jobs and donate most of the profits to charity.



We don't care when you work, as long as the work is flawless and deadlines are met. Whether you are a night owl or a morning person, you will have total autonomy over your schedule.



What You’ll Do



Full-Cycle Bookkeeping: Maintain clean, audit-ready books for multiple entities.



Financial Reporting: Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual P&L, Balance Sheets, and Cash Flow statements.



Reconciliations: Perform complex bank, credit card, and intercompany reconciliations.



M&A Support: Assist in financial due diligence for potential new acquisitions (analyzing historical data and verifying financial health).



Process Improvement: Build and scale accounting workflows that work across our entire portfolio.



Who You Are



Licensed CPA: You must hold a current CPA license (US).



Experience: 5+ years in accounting, preferably with experience in US GAAP or international reporting.



M&A Mindset: You don't just "do the math"—you understand what the numbers mean for a business's valuation.



Tech-Savvy: Expert-level proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Xero, and Excel.



Reliable: Since this is a fully asynchronous role, you must be a self-starter who communicates proactively.



Why Work With Us?



True Flexibility: No "required hours." Work whenever you are most productive.



Stability: This is a full-time, long-term position within a growing portfolio.



Competitive Salary: Paid in USD, bi-monthly.



Growth: Exposure to various industries and the inner workings of business acquisitions.

description:

, CRM, video calls)

title: Operations & Dispatch Coordinator (Virtual Dispatcher – PH, Full Time, Work From Home)
description:
We’re Site Masters, a fast?growing junk removal and light demolition company serving Tampa Bay, Florida (US).



We’re hiring a full?time Operations & Dispatch Coordinator in the Philippines to manage phones, schedules, and routing for our crews. If you’re calm under pressure, great on the phone with Americans, and like keeping things organized, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do

Answer inbound calls from US customers (residential & commercial) with a friendly, confident tone

Make outbound calls for estimate follow ups, missed calls, and basic invoice reminders

Book and update jobs in our software (Jobber) and keep customers updated with ETAs

Build and adjust daily routes for 2–3 trucks so days are efficient

Track tech time (clock ins / clock outs / job durations) and close out jobs accurately

Maintain simple spreadsheets for leads, jobs, and basic COGS (disposal, hours, fuel)

Help with recurring admin tasks, organizing photos, Google Drive folders, and simple reports

You will work directly with the owner and an existing VA. This is a long?term role with room to grow into senior operations if you perform well.



Requirements

Location: Philippines (home?based, quiet workspace)

Experience:

2+ years as a VA, dispatcher, scheduler, or operations coordinator for a US?based service company (construction, cleaners, junk removal, home services, etc.)

Solid phone experience with US clients (inbound + outbound)

Skills:

Excellent spoken and written English

Confident on live calls; can handle upset customers calmly

Comfortable with CRMs / job management tools (Jobber a plus), Google Workspace, and spreadsheets

Good with numbers and details (time tracking, simple P&L, invoices)

Technical Setup:

Reliable computer (i5/Ryzen 5 or better, 8GB+ RAM)

Stable wired internet (at least 25 Mbps) + backup internet

Quality USB headset and quiet workspace

Willing to use Hubstaff for time tracking and screenshots

Schedule & Compensation

Hours: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM EST, Monday–Friday (with 30–60 min lunch)

Sometimes: 1–2 Saturday half days per month during busy periods (extra pay)

Salary Range: $1,300 – $1,500 USD/month, depending on experience and performance

Extras:

1 paid day off per month after probation

Paid PH regular holidays after probation

Performance bonuses based on reliability, accuracy, and call handling

Stable, long?term role with growth potential

How To Apply (Follow Exactly)

When you apply through OnlineJobs.ph, include the following at the top of your message:



Your expected monthly salary in USD

A 2–4 sentence summary of your US phone experience (inbound & outbound)

Your internet speed (download/upload) and a short description of your computer setup

Shortlisted applicants will be invited to a second step with a short call scenario and tech check.

title: Transaction Coordinator & Disposition Manager Needed for Real Estate Wholesaling
description:
Disposition Manager (Real Estate Wholesaling)



Company: Release Properties (U.S. Based Real Estate Firm)

Location: Remote (Eastern Time)

Employment Type: Full-Time (48 hrs/week)

Start Date: Immediate

Compensation: Base Pay + Commissions per Closed Deal + Performance Bonuses



How to Apply

Please share a 1–2 minute video introduction in English talking about your background, communication experience, and why you’d be a great fit for this role.

Drop your WhatsApp as well for Quick Communication.



About Release Properties



Release Properties is a fast-growing real estate investment company specializing in buying off-market residential properties and selling them to a curated network of cash buyers and investors. We focus on transparency, speed, and results — offering sellers quick, fair deals and investors high-value opportunities.



As our Disposition Manager, you’ll be responsible for turning signed contracts into closed deals — marketing properties, managing buyer relationships, negotiating assignments, and coordinating closings.



Core Mission

Your mission is simple: turn inventory into cash by selling contracts quickly and profitably while maintaining strong relationships with our investor network.



Key Responsibilities



Property Marketing & Buyer Outreach

Launch new deals to buyers within hours of contract execution.

Market properties using
 campaigns, CRM blasts,
 groups, Craigslist, and other investor channels.

Create engaging property listings and buyer packets with all key details (ARV, comps, rehab estimates, pictures).



Buyer Relations & Negotiation

Build, grow, and maintain a strong network of cash buyers and investor partners.

Negotiate assignment fees and contract terms that maximize company profit.

Follow up daily with buyers through calls, texts, and
s to create urgency and close quickly.



Transaction Coordination

Coordinate with title companies, escrow officers, and attorneys to ensure smooth closings.

Track deal progress, resolve title or buyer issues, and maintain clear communication across all parties.

Ensure accurate, compliant documentation for each transaction.



Market Research & Feedback Loop

Run comps using PropStream, Zillow, Redfin, and ChatGPT tools.

Stay updated on local market conditions, investor trends, and pricing benchmarks.

Provide insights to the acquisitions team for better property selection and pricing strategy.



Reporting & CRM Management

Keep CRM updated with all buyer interactions, notes, and statuses.

Track KPIs: time-to-market, engagement, contracts assigned, and closing ratios.

Generate weekly disposition performance reports for management review.



Tools You’ll Use

CRM: GoHighLevel and InvestorLift

Property Data: PropStream, Zillow, Redfin

Communication: GoHighLevel

Marketing:
/SMS tools, Canva, ChatGPT,
/Craigslist

Tracking: Google Sheets, KPI Dashboards



Qualifications

1–3 years of experience in real estate wholesaling, dispositions, or investment sales.

Strong negotiation, relationship-building, and communication skills.

Confident with property valuation, comps, and real estate contracts.

Excellent written and spoken English.

Tech-savvy, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently.

Self-motivated and results-driven, with a passion for closing deals.

Preferred:



Existing network of U.S. real estate investors and cash buyers.

Familiarity with ReSimpli, InvestorLift, or similar CRM platforms.

Experience with
 marketing for real estate.

Compensation & Growth

Base hourly rate (DOE) + generous commissions per closed assignment

Performance-based bonuses

Paid training and continuous support

Clear promotion path to Senior Disposition Manager / Team Lead

Long-term opportunity with a fast-scaling U.S. investment firm

title: Are You a Rock Star Marketing + Design Executive?
description:
A fantastic opportunity has become available for a talented Marketing & Design Executive to join People Pillar remotely from the Philippines on a full-time contract.

You’ll support our UK-based HR consultancy by designing and delivering marketing that’s smart, consistent, and on-brand. You’ll receive briefs from our team across everything from market research and campaign planning to content creation and execution.

You’ll be confident using Canva (essential), comfortable with other design and editing tools, and happy working across common marketing platforms (including LinkedIn). You’ll have strong written and spoken English, a stable internet connection, and the ability to deliver high-quality work to deadlines.

Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities

• Market research: competitor and market analysis, identifying opportunities, gaps, and content angles

• Copywriting + creative: write clear, engaging marketing copy and create matching visuals

• Design delivery: create new and original designs and marketing assets from scratch ( using a brief) 

• Produce a wide variety of collateral, including:

o Banners and branded graphics

o Flyers and posters

o Workbooks and PDFs

o Social media posts and templates

o Marketing
s and simple
 layouts

• Photo/video editing: basic editing to support campaigns and social content

• Campaign execution: help manage and publish content across website, social media, and offline channels (as needed)

• Online Event Set-up : support planning and delivery 

• Ad hoc projects: jump in where needed to keep marketing moving

• Manage your time to ensure deadlines are met and quality stays consistently high

• Create and maintain organised files for all creative assets so everything can be found easily

• Understand the why behind each project so you can add value beyond “making it look good”

Tools & Skills You’ll Need

• Strong Canva skills (required)

• Comfortable with other design/editing apps (for example Adobe tools, CapCut, or similar)

• Confident copywriting skills in English (tone-aware, clear, and audience-focused)

• Familiarity with LinkedIn and common marketing platforms

• Excellent attention to detail and a strong eye for brand consistency

• Reliable, stable internet connection suitable for remote work

Personal Characteristics Required

• Driven and proactive

• Highly organised

• Meticulous attention to detail

• Creative and solutions-focused

• Able to plan effectively and meet deadlines

• Effective problem solver, motivated to deliver high-quality results

• At least 3 years of relevant experience in marketing execution, content creation, design, or similar

You’ll always start with the why, embrace a collaborative team environment, and pursue growth and learning every single day. 

We think big, never let our teammates down, and we celebrate the wins.

Working Hours & Availability

This is a full-time contract role, working remotely from your home in the Philippines.

You can choose your working hours for flexibility (we understand there’s a time difference). However, you must be online and available between 10:30 am – 4:30 pm GMT for team communication.

Why This Role?

This is a brilliant job for someone who actually gives a damn, a chance to make a real impact and contribute to something bigger than yourself. There’s also a significant opportunity to grow your skills across marketing strategy, execution, and creative.

How to Apply

To be considered as a serious candidate, please send:

• A short cover letter

• Your portfolio (or links to examples of your work)

IMPORTANT: In your cover letter, please tell us your favourite colour. (It’s how we can tell you’ve read the job description!)

The Application Process

If successful, the next stage of the process involves answering a few short questions so we can better understand you. You will also be asked to complete a small piece of sample work to help us accurately judge your marketing, copy, and design skills.

IMPORTANT: Any sample work you create is purely to judge your skills and will not be used for commercial purposes.

title: VA for US Healthcare Credentialing and Billing
description:
Job Description



Virtual Assistant – Healthcare Credentialing & Billing



Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Virtual Assistant with experience in US healthcare

credentialing and billing, primarily for Nurse Practitioners. The Virtual Assistant will provide

administrative support, ensure accurate processing of credentialing applications, and assist with

billing processes. This is a remote, per diem role.

other healthcare providers.

? Track credentialing status and follow up with insurance companies, networks, and

relevant authorities.

Billing Support

? Prepare billing information and submit claims for processing.

? Assist with verification of payer requirements and documentation.

? Monitor claim status and assist in resolving discrepancies.

? Maintain accurate records and reporting for billing and credentialing activities.



Administrative Support

? Assist with communication and coordination between providers, clients, and insurance

networks.

? Perform other administrative tasks as assigned, related to credentialing and billing.

? Other duties may be assigned.



Qualifications

Education

? High school diploma or equivalent required; associate or bachelor’s degree preferred



Experience

? Prior experience in US healthcare credentialing and/or billing

? Familiarity with Nurse Practitioner documentation and licensure requirements

? Experience with electronic health records (EHR) or credentialing software preferred



Skills and Competencies

? Strong organizational and time-management skills

? Detail-oriented and accurate in documentation

? Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

? Ability to work independently in a remote environment

? Professional, reliable, and trustworthy with sensitive information



Schedule and Availability

? Remote, as-needed basis

? Flexible hours coordinated with supervisor

? No minimum or guaranteed hours

title: Marketplace Customer Experience specialist (E-commerce)
description:
Reports to: COO

Location: Remote

Employment type: Full-time

Salary: $1,000 per month (depending on experience)

Working hours: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM (Manila time)

Start date: As soon as possible



Are you passionate about customers, branding and e-commerce growth?

We are looking for a Customer Experience Specialist who wants to do more than just answer tickets.

In this role, you will help us build strong brands, increase customer trust and improve marketplace performance through excellent communication and valuable customer insights.

This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to grow with the company and develop their career.





About Onebird



Onebird is a Dutch e-commerce company active in the home décor and personal equipment category. We sell exclusively on 
 and manage multiple fast-growing brands that generate millions of euros in annual revenue.



Our goal is to build scalable, market-leading brands. As we continue to expand our product range and professionalize our operations, we are also growing our remote team. We are looking for talented professionals who want to grow with us long term.





About the role



The Marketplace Customer Experience Specialist plays a key role in our business.



You will be responsible for customer communication across marketplaces and social media, while also helping improve products, reviews, listings and overall customer satisfaction.



You will work closely with the COO, operations and marketing teams to turn customer feedback into real improvements.



This role combines:



- Customer support

- Review and trust management

- Influencer and UGC coordination

- Product and process improvement





Key responsibilities



Customer Experience & Support



- Respond to customer questions via
, chat and marketplaces

- Handle order issues, returns and replacements

- Handle product-related issues and actively find solutions for customers

- Support customers with product usage, installation and troubleshooting

- Communicate professionally and empathetically with customers

- Maintain fast and high-quality responses



Reviews & Trust



- Proactively contact unhappy customers

- Recover negative reviews where possible

- Improve customer satisfaction and trust

- Support marketplace ranking through strong customer communication



Customer Insights & Improvements



- Identify recurring problems and patterns in customer feedback

- Share insights with operations and product teams

- Contribute to continuous product and process improvements



Social Media & UGC



- Respond to customer messages and comments on social media

- Reach out to micro-influencers using templates

- Track influencer shipments and content

- Coordinate and schedule approved UGC posts (Instagram & TikTok)





Key KPIs



- First Response Time (FRT)

- Resolution Time (TTR)

- Customer satisfaction and review recovery

- Speed and consistency of social media responses

- Influencer content and UGC output

- Number of suggested and implemented improvements







Requirements



- Experience in e-commerce, marketplaces or DTC brands

- Experience in translations (NL) customer service language

- Strong written communication skills

- Structured, organized and detail-oriented

- Empathetic and solution-driven

- Proactive and ownership mindset

- Comfortable working remotely with international teams

- Experience with SOP creation and process improvement

- Interest in branding, customer psychology and growth



Bonus if you have



- Experience with Amazon, 
, Shopify or similar platforms

- Influencer or UGC outreach experience

- Social media customer communication

- Understanding of reviews, trust and conversion





Why join Onebird?



- Work directly with founders and senior leadership

- Real impact on fast-growing brands

- Long-term opportunity and career growth

- Remote and flexible work environment
